Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Chicko2075
Reviews.Content: We stayed a little over a week for business, the wireless internet was great, as too was the small shop that you could charge things to you room. The staff were friendly and service was great, but the food quality in the restaurant was below average. The major issue here is three things that would make it great; Air con that is not noisy ( apparently all of them are in the rooms) Better beds, we had to sleep in seperate beds Better standard of food for room service. One the up side I am sure that it is priced well, but the big school groups made for a nosiy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a second”
Reviews.Author: cupcake2006
Reviews.Content: As someone who normally stays in a villa or a condo when we travel to Orlando (which is one or twice a year) we were able to get a last minuet deal with flights and hotel booked as a package that worked out at an amazing price and went for it!!!! I was a bit nervous as I wasn't sure what kind of Hilton this was going to be and worried that it was going to be a bit dated, motel type thing!! WOW was I wrong, I can not say one bad thing about this hotel!!!! We were there for a week and breakfast was included. Breakfast was immense it was a buffet with the normal toast, cereals & fruit and then there was a hot items section with eggs made to order whatever way you wanted them and there was also a waffle station and a cake/muffin section. If I remember correctly if you were to buy the Buffet it was about $12 which we would not have paid as we are happy with a donut but as it was included we were over the moon!!! We ate there every morning and loved it. The room was spacious, clean and modern - everything you would want from a hotel room and free wifi! We had requested a room on a high floor as if you were on the side of the building overlooking Sea World you can see the fireworks (a tip I got from a previous review) and we watched the fireworks almost every night!!! We used the pool everyday and it was clean and well laid out!! Not too busy either. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we loved the cookies left out on the reception desk every night. Loved this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend it to anybody and I would go back in a second!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Sea World and Aquatica”
Reviews.Author: Andrew K
Reviews.Content: We were in the area and needed a room for 4 nights because we were going to Sea World and Aquatica great location close to disney close to universal plenty to do and see around hotel very safe area clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great !!!!.... Do not exit at Consulate drive without a sunpass”
Reviews.Author: country033
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, room, pool was clean n staff was friendly n conveniently located....however our garmin was programmed to the hotel address n we exited off the turnpike on consulate drive not knowing until it was too late about a sunpass only exit, there r no attendants...we r waiting for our fine by license plate in the mail....just a helpful hint!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location Near Sea World, Aquatica”
Reviews.Author: dv83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good place to stay for those visiting Sea World and Aquatica. There is a shuttle available which is conveniant. There is plenty of parking, staff is attentive, microwave, small refrigerator, and room is quiet. there is a nice view from the upper floors too. What keeps this hotel from being rated higher is that it will not win any awards for room cleanliness. My kids found a beer can under the bed. The base boards in the bathroom has a large collection of stains. The room could benefit from some touch painting. Matress also had some use as it sagged in the middle. There is no complementary breakfast. Excercise room was nice. Overall I would stay there again. My family had a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Hospi3
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for about a week for vacation at the parks nearby and to visit some family members who live in the Orlando area. Our check-in took two seconds, extremely impersonal...never used our name, never acknowledged our needs that were clearly in our reservation. Our room was horrible. Upon entering, one bed was shorter than the other height-wise. Throughout our stay the shorter bed was losing stuffing from somewhere, never did find the source. The other bed was just broken. I went to search under the bed to find a shoe and there was broken wood and little nails coming down. We had to ask for our rollaway that was in the reservation. We had to request extra towels, other than the for provided for our family of 5...everyday! Nobody ever caught on to that basic need. Also in the reservation. Due to our tight schedule we did not have the time to sit around our room waiting for all of this. The pool was nice and well maintained and the breakfast staff, in particular Juan was very accommodating. He always remembered our family. Another special person was our bus driver to Seaworld this past Monday morning...extremely friendly. Other than that, any staff we encountered put their head down or just ignored my family's presence. If you want a place to stay anonymous and are not too particular about your room needing some TLC, this is the place for you. If you are not looking for "service" you'll be good here. The location is good and the shuttle service to the parks is fine. There is a CVS which is right across and convenient. The saying you never get a second chance to make a first impression is so true. We had a more memorable stay at the Hampton Inn in NC...and we were only there 8 hours!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Sea World and Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: robmars
Reviews.Content: Spend 4 nights with family, walking distance to Sea World (although there where a shuttle bus). Fast ticket pass to Sea World via Hotel. Excellent service, near to everything. By car 15 min to Disney parks and great shopping at the two major outlets in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Thorn054
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for one night at the end of our trip to Clearwater and Orlando. I picked this hotel based on the reviews and must admit that I was pretty disappointed. First the good - we arrived at noon (4-hours before the normal check-in time) and they gave us an early check in for the two rooms that we reserved. The front desk clerk (unfortunately I can't recall her name) was very helpful and friendly. She was more than willing to get us in early and was very, very pleasant. The other hotel staff that I encountered also seemed very friendly. The hotel common areas and rooms also seem very clean. The not so good - my biggest complaint was the A/C unit in our rooms. Despite setting the temperature to 72, it would cool to around 74 then the heat would literally kick in and crank the room up to 80 degrees. These temperature swings kept happening no matter what we tried. After setting the temperature even lower (69 - 70) and hoping for success, we left the room for a while and when we came back - it was a balmy 80 degrees again. Early that evening, we called the front desk and reported the issue prior to going out and grabbing some dinner. They said that they'd send the maintenance guy up right away and when we came back, the temperature seemed to be going back down (it was around 74). Unfortunately, it was going through yet another temperature swing so we called the front desk again. They said that the maintenance guy reported that he had checked it out and it was "working fine." The room cranked up to 80 degrees yet again and the maintenance guy came back and apparently, did some additional investigation. He spent about 10-minutes looking at things (mind you - this was around 10 PM) and determined that the thermostat had a short in it (I'm not sure why this wasn't figured out on the first visit earlier). He then disconnected the thermostat and had us adjust the A/C unit directly. He then said that he'd come back in about 15-minutes to make sure things were working OK but never showed up. Since things seemed to be working OK at that point, we waited it out until 11 PM and decided that he wasn't coming back to check again and decided to go to bed since we had to be up early for our flight. The front desk never called back either to make sure things had been worked out. During the night, the room got stuffy again so I'm not sure the unit ever really worked properly. All in all, it was pretty annoying. I would have to say that the hotel is convenient to Sea World and about 15-minutes from Disney, depending on the traffic. I also paid a rate of $109/night so the price was good. However, as far as "ambiance" goes, I would say this hotel seems to greatly miss the mark. It's a basic, hotel that seems better suited for the business traveler or for folks wanting to go to Sea World. There also isn't much around to walk to (besides Sea Word and a few other places). Overall - we weren't impressed with our experience and I would recommend that you stay somewhere else. Even setting the A/C problems aside, I wouldn't choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, nothing extravagant!”
Reviews.Author: AsianMom03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your standard nothing special hotel. It was clean, good location for the Sea World parks and that's about it. It offers standard size rooms with microwave and mini frige, which is nice. They do offer complimentary shuttle services to the parks and quick queue passes for Sea World, that's where the extras end. We were lucky to be on a floor that was totally non-smoking, however, they do have other floors that were half smoking half not. (for my family that's not cool, all we lucked out) They have one standard size pool, again nothing special. Though the hotel has a mini store in the lobby for those forgotten items or late night snacks... Don't bother! You're better of running to the CVS just down the road, because those prices were insane! The walls are very thin, no privacy here! Overall, the hotel was nice just nothing special!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: vernkaye
Reviews.Content: The night prior to our expected arrival, I received an email from Brian (a new front desk employee). He asked if there was anything that he could help with, before we arrived. I asked if he couldn’t block our favorite room, and hinted that we might arrive at the hotel a little early. Within a few minutes I got a short and sweet email in reply. “Your requested room has been blocked. We look forward to seeing you, Sir!” The next morning my wife and I arrived a few minutes after 10:00 A.M. (We know that regular check-in time is normally 3:00 P.M). Anyway, it just so happened that the young man at the front desk was Brian; who welcomed us with a handshake and a smile. Your room is ready, Mr. Kaye, but we are changing the shower head; so it will be just a few minutes before I can give you the key cards. What I expected, was the normal….. come back after 3:00 PM, or maybe try 4:00 PM (just to be sure), but that wasn’t the case then. In a few minutes we were on our way to our favorite room (5 to 6 hours ahead of check in time). While we were waiting (for the key cards); Patricia (Associate of the year); had finished up with another guest. She recognized me by face, and come over to the side of the check in counter. After a hand shake, she reached over and gave me a big hug, along and a friendly “Welcome Back”. I turned around to see Gary, (Food and Beverage Manager); giving my wife a big hug. I thought to myself, “This is more like a family reunion; then a hotel check in”. Minutes later, we were in our favorite room. My wife started unpacking bags, while I took the baggage cart back to the front lobby of the hotel. On my way back up to our top floor room, the elevator doors opened on the second floor. A young man, pushed a vacuum cleaner into the elevator, than pushed a floor button. Then he pushed a higher floor number. He then turned to me and said….”Excuse me Sir, but I pushed the wrong button”. As we both watched the doors open and close, he said…”I sure want to apologize for slowing you down today.” Then as he exited on the right floor, he said….”Have a nice day, Sir”. As I walked down the hall to be with my wife, I couldn’t help thinking about that fine, courteous young man, who we had never seen or met before. This young man had no idea that my wife and I had stayed in this hotel (last year), for a total of 55 nights. Nor did he have any idea that this trip, we were planning to stay for 11 nights. Yes, this fine young man (who I still don’t know by name); took time from his job as “Young Man in charge of Vacuuming the Halls”; to (for a minute) become “Director of Public Relations” for the entire Hilton Garden Inn chain. Is there any wonder that last year, I gave this hotel a sparkling, shining, positive response on TripAdvisor? And is there any question as to why my wife and I always stay at this hotel, when we are visiting Orlando? Good Value, and Great Service. All the best and “Thank You” again, to the Hilton Garden Inn-SeaWorld, team.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden GEM”
Reviews.Author: Red_Dolphin-Media
Reviews.Content: I have heard other reviewers say this but some of Hilton's best properties are NOT the on the highest end of their price scale..in fact I have come to love Hilton Garden Inn more than most full-service Hiltons! I moved to this hotel after staying at the Hilton Downtown Disney for one evening...originally had been moved to a nearby Hampton Inn that didn't work out so well. They welcomed me here for 4 nights and I was extremely impressed. From the moment I checked in with Brian, things were terrific. The room was large, with extremely comfortable beds, flat screen tv, fridge, microwave, and GREAT desk. Very strong wifi, and great AC. I am a Hilton Honrs Gold member so they included the breakfast buffet for me each day which was awesome. Heated pool and jacuzzi were excellent, and the hotel has on-site laundry, a 24 hour convenience area off the front desk with snacks and sundries, and a 24 hour CVS and 7-Eleven across the street. It is also within true walking distance to the Sea World entrance, even though it has free shuttles running. Parking at the hotel was free and I had no problems getting a spot. Lobby is nice with a great bar, and they have the nightly tradition of cookies at the front desk which was great! They also use some Neutrogena soap products in the room which were great! Note: the one thing I had to work around was the lack of safe in the room (I carry multiple computers), but the front desk had HUGE safe deposit boxes available and I stored my computers there when away and it worked out really well. I will definitely be back here...the value and the service offering are among the best I have found here. Disney's Magic Kingdom took me about 15 mins to drive to on I-4...but i was so easy with I-4 right outside the hotel (no lights once on I-4). Thanks to everyone working here for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient and with top staff”
Reviews.Author: TOB_HH
Reviews.Content: The heading says it all - just to add that everyone I dealt with was not just polite, not just helpful, they were super helpful and unfailingly friendly. You get the feeling that the staff enjoy working here, and it shows. And the ladies at breakfast are charming! Very handy is the facility to print documents with a confidential code on the printer near the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Der_Franzes
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to all corners of the world and have experienced varying levels of service and hospitality in the hotel industry but I have to say that the staff here at the Hilton Garden Inn will forever stand out as being the finest in the business. My initial reservations were outside the block time needed to secure a special rate. I brought this to the attention of the staff and within minutes they left a kind and pleasant message on my voice mail stating that the price will be adjusted to reflect the discounted rate. This is just one small example of the many overwhelming acts of kindness the staff portrayed over the course of my stay. A heartfelt thank you to the entire staff but especially to Nour and Emilee who went above and beyond my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: AC_A340
Reviews.Content: I spent almost 2 weeks here recently on business, and have no real complaints, or criticisms. It's not a luxury resort, but it's perfectly suited for any length of stay. It was lacking in a couple of things, but it made up for it in every other way. The place was easy to find once we picked up our rental car from the airport. Rooms were clean and spacious. Odd numbered rooms face SeaWorld. Supposedly SeaWorld fireworks, but I never saw/heard any. Here's the good: 1.) Air conditioners worked awesome. Some people said they were too loud, but they're the same as every other in-room AC I've ever used. If the sound of it kicking on bothers you, just leave the fan on. That way it's less noticeable. 2.) Free WiFi. 3.) Breakfast was huge. Our corporate rate provided it for us, but even the cash price was fair. 4.) Access to I-Drive and Convention Centre. If you have a car, there is a multitude of restaurants within a 10 min drive. Downtown Disney, and the outlet mall is also <10 min drive. Universal is a bit further, but still easy to get to. Couple minor things... 1.) The fridges in the room worked well. A little too well. Stuff would routinely freeze in them. It wasn't just mine, all the other people in my group reported a similar problem. 2.) Gym is small. Granted most people at hotels in Orlando get plenty of exercise at the amusements, those on business don't. Would have been nice if it was slightly larger with more free weights or weight machines. 3.) No usable stairs. I had the intent of using the stairs at the hotel instead of the elevator, but unfortunately you have no access to them from the main floor unless you go through the ballrooms. So they suited their purpose as a fire escape, but that's it. 4.) Beds were firmish. Fitted sheet kept sliding off and the comforter was sort of lumpy. I still slept ok, and they did have an assortment of pillows. 5.) Bathrooms are small, and not very well laid out. Staff at the hotel was able to resolve every issue I had. The bar opens up at 5 pm. Drinks are pretty pricey, but the CVS Pharmacy across the street had everything you needed. And a 7-11 just opened up beside it. The both sell beer and everything else. SeaWorld is super close. Pedestrian entrance is less than a block away. No idea why anyone would take the bus there. There isn't much else within a reasonable walk. Everything was a 20 min walk minimum if you had no car. I would have no hesitation about going back, but the hotel is more set up for business travelers with a vehicle as opposed to families on vacation. I will most likely be back on business again. I gave the location 3 stars only because it's not within a short walking distance to much. The area is still slowly developing. If you want to take a jog or anything it takes about 30 mins to go all the way around SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and recommend to family and friends”
Reviews.Author: Shari1523
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a trip to Disney for my birthday. We were both pleasantly surprised by how nice this hotel is. It was like being back home. We stayed in the 1 bedroom. They had a full kitchen with all the dishes, cups, silverware, dishwasher, and full size refrigerator, they even had a wine opener. They also had a very nice screened in porch to sit on and enjoy. The restaurant that was off of the pool area was not very good service or food. They are right across the street from Sea World so you could walk there. They are not far from Disney and plenty of restaurants to choice from. We will stay again if we travel to Orlando again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to hold a meeting”
Reviews.Author: Ken P
Reviews.Content: We hosted a local planning meeting in the meeting rooms. Everything was ready when we needed it. The building engineer was quick to respond to air conditioning requests when some guests were too cold. Food was as ordered and delivered on time. I have used this location before and will do so again for meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sky0000547
Reviews.Content: This review has been a long time coming. I stayed at the HGI from Labor Day weekend 2011 for 10 days to visit Orlando and the parks. The hotel offers ample free parking to the sides and rear and there was no issues of finding a space in September. The rooms offered a large flat screen TV, a fridge, microwave and a coffee making machine. The only thing that is missing and to some travellers which is quite important is an in-room safe. Apparently you can also leave your valueables in the hotel safe at reception but that is very inconvenient. There is complimentary in-room wifi and wired internet connection. The front desk was pleasant at check-in. My room had a constant running water problem with the toilet but maintenance sorted the problem out in no time. I had a buffet breakfast daily which consisted of your usual eggs, sausages, cereals etc. The restaurant staff soon got used to my face on a daily basis and all very pleasant with tea, coffee and juice. There is also a self serve area set up in the bar with tea, coffee and hot chocolate in the morning. On the ground floor there is a small gym and outside is the pool area. The hotel location is excellent with SeaWorld directly opposite. I left the car in the hotel car park and walked across to SeaWorld which took about 10mins through the SeaWorld car park and saving $14 in parking charges. The trolley/bus stop is immediately outside the hotel. Driving to Disney takes approximately 15mins travelling straight onto the I4. Orlando International Airport is 15mins from the hotel this time straight onto the 528. If you have a room facing SeaWorld, you can sometimes see the firework display too. There is an Expedia travel desk in the lobby, if you are planning to visit SeaWorld then go to the travel desk early in the morning on the day of your visit and ask for a quick queue voucher. This is complimentary to all quests staying at the hotel. Overall this is a lovely clean well priced hotel to stay in Orlando. If you have access to a car then the hotel is well located to all attractions. The negatives I have are no in-room safe, air conditioner a bit noisy and the mattress topping which I am not a big fan of.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mlundin13
Reviews.Content: Great service. Great people. The rooms were the cleanest ive ever seen. The beds are out of this world, so comfortable. Had a great stay. Highly recommend. Thank you Hilton garden inn for a great stay, experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: bignanavc
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Hilton Garden because of its price and close proximity to Seaworld, right across the parking lot. Everything about the hotel was really nice, from the front desk folks to the servers in the restaurant. The room was very clean. We will definatly stay here again and will recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: PLAM-BR
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property several times already. They are very consistent, nice location, good breakfast, rooms are confortable and new. Miss a safe in the room, but they have at front desk. Overall a stress free stay. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mkpacman71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the first week in December and paid about $55 a night for the room. I was a bit apprehensive based on the price, but had read good reviews - after all, how picky can you be for $55 a night.. well, this place was great. An awesome location, clean rooms, friendly staff. It is within walking distance of Sea World, a CVS and a very short drive to everything else in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Service from the front desk was the BEST thing about our stay.”
Reviews.Author: montcalmharls
Reviews.Content: All in all, the hotel was in a good location, clean, a decent value and satisfactory. We paid EXTRA for our room to have a pull out couch. That pull out was awful.. The mattress was TIED to the couch with string since the springs were missing. Our 9 year old complained of his back hurting after the 1st night. Since the hotel was at capacity and we needed ajoining rooms, we could not go to another room. Out package included breakfast each morning that was ok. The most memorable thing about our stay was the front desk associate. She was unbelievably helpful with everything from theme park times,nearby drug stores, restaurants to try, best way to get to our destination and friendly advice on what was worth going to. She made a mediopcre hotel a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “:(/:)”
Reviews.Author: RippingMK
Reviews.Content: We were very unfortunate to not be able to make it to the PGA Show this year thus we were unable to spend our nights in this beutiful hotel. Last year we stayed here I loved it great hotel great staff great rooms great beds. Lets hope 2012 is a better year for my family as we've been going through hard times this year. Again thank you for a great stay in 2011 I hope to be back here in 2013!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: edsony
Reviews.Content: I shared a room with my wife, a friend of hers and her daughter. Friendly and very helpful staff was able to get lots of packages from mail order for me. Very clean acommodations with enough space for large pieces of luggage. Location is very good. It's really walking distance from Sea World but be aware that it's quite a long walk as you have to cross the entire parking lot (not very nice after a entire day inside the park under 97F). At night you can see the fireworks show from your room if it's facing the park or from the hotel parking lot. Definitely will consider as an option when returning to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “a great post-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: HButt347
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn at Seaworld on January 21st. The staff was friendly and very accomodating considering that we had arrived mid-morning from the cruise port. The hotel is a Seaworld partner which allows for a complimentary shuttle, quick-queue braclets and a very friendly conceirge in the hotel lobby that will answer all your questions. The room was clean, free wi-fi throughout the hotel, a business center, and a beautiful outdoor heated pool completed our stay. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: ldsplus
Reviews.Content: Very clean amenities, friendly staff; they let us in at 11:30 am as soon as we arrived. We had few requests, it was addressed immediately. Shuttle to parks runs four times a day: twice in the morning and twice in the evening. Close to public transportation as well. Across the street big pharmacy with convenience store items. We got good deal on prices as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Anita P
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was the best I've ever encountered. They had a problem, handled it, compensated for it (waived some fees AND gave our group a coffee/refreshment break), and EVERYONE was so kind, including the general manager, who personally apologized and asked if there was anything more they could do. They were more than fair. e.g. The banquet manager asked my husband's favorite beverage (regular Dr. Pepper) and he personally went out and bought him a six-pack. Almost everything was perfect, but you really know the quality of a hotel experience if there's a problem and they truly step up to the plate. I can't say enough about this wonderful property and its management and staff. Everyone made us feel very welcome and important.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for disney and Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Louisemcc
Reviews.Content: Very large, clean rooms, good value for money. Excellent transportation right outside the door are stops for 50lynx to Disney, 111lynx to Florida Mall and airport and Iride 31 & 32! No wasting time transferring at different stops. Also the hotel runs free shuttle bus to Universal, Busch Gardens and Seaworld although Seaworld is just 5 minute walk. as its a seaworld hotel you also get free quick queue each day for seaworld, discount at the restaurants/shops and early morning entry. On late nights back to hotel from parks we ordered pizza from restaurant and it was only $20 for lg bottle of coke and lg pizza. great selection at breakfast whcih we had included in our booking but you can buy for $12/day over there. Cereal, waffles, pancakes, donuts, eggs, sausage, bacon, yogs, toast, fruit, etc. Also the CVS store is just opposite the hotel, great for cheap bottles of water and snacks for park trips. I would definately stay here again and next time I wouldn't organise an expensive transfer to hotel as we got the 111 Lynx back to Orlando International airport from right outside the door of the hotel for $7 total for 3 adults and 1 child!!! The Lynx takes you straight to airport within 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ivan G
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inn Orlando at SeaWorld I recommend: - clean - prices are good - location is good

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Hilton Garden Inn Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Shirley P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Orlando. Room was clean and had amenities needed. Staff was very courteous, friendly and helpful. Great location....hotel was close to Sea World and Discovery Cove. Buffet breakfast was great. Pricing was good too. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Pool area was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ms0758
Reviews.Content: I was in Orlando for a conference and found the Hilton Garden Inn Orlando at SeaWorld a great place to stay. The room was very comfortable (except for noisy airconditioning), clean, and well-sized (smoking is allowed in some rooms). Wireless internet worked flawlessly and you could even print for free (files sent electronically and you pick up at printer). Breakfast buffet was good and plentyful and there is also a pantry where you can buy meals to heat up in your room. What I enjoyed most was the friendly and helpful staff, who always greeted you with a big smile. It is a bit off the beaten track, but there is an I-ride trolley stop and a bus stop in front of the entrance and if you have a car, it is no problem at all (free parking). I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel with excellant customer service”
Reviews.Author: EMMA_WEEKS
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable hotel with excellant customer service. The breakfast buffet was great, very tasty, the staff were so polite and helpful. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay! Employees were very friendly-great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DFflorida
Reviews.Content: I will stay here again. The staff, location, and grounds were all fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: SisterScribe
Reviews.Content: I was angst-ridden trying to find an affordable hotel for just a couple of nights so I could take my daughter to the Magic Kingdom. Now, Sea World isn't walking distance from the Magic Kingdom, but it sure isn't far, and the hotel has a shuttle to Disney with a limited schedule. We decided to drive and pay to park so we could choose when to come and go. The Hilton Garden Inn Orlando at SeaWorld was exactly what I wanted. A clean place for us to relax and lay our heads. The staff was really friendly, courteous and helpful. The hotel lobby was inviting and decorated nicely for the holidays. Our room was perfect for the two of us, and coming and going from this hotel was a breeze. There's a shopping center just two miles away, good for quick meals or groceries. I've stayed in some fine hotels in my day, and I really enjoyed this one.

Reviews.Title: “Another Pleasurable Stay”
Reviews.Author: carrekei
Reviews.Content: We have used this hotel several times with the family or on our own.This time it was only the wife and I stayed for 15 nights and I must say the service level from associates is as high as it was on our first stay a few years ago. The room spacious and very clean with the room overlooking SeaWorld at the back of the hotel, which was great to view the Seaworld firework display on New Years Eve. This hotel has a great atmosphere the Hilton associates are always only to pleased to satisfy no matter what is being asked of them. In the morning you can get free coffee in the bar which I used daily while I waited for the family for breakfast while watching the news on the TV and using my laptop to use the free internet connection yes it is still FREE. The restaurant/bar serves excellent food and would highly recommend eating in the resturant The food is EXCELLENT. Seaworld is a five minute walk away or use the hotel shuttle service which also goes to the other main parks, Nothing has changed Great Hotel, Great Loaction and Fantastic Associates. If you can find a better hotel not just for money but service level I suggest you book it, but I don't think you will. If you consider the whole package, Hilton Associates, service level, food, and location I do not beleive you will beat it. Clearly the management have got the training and the skill of associates right, and will with a doubt will be using this hotel for future vacations. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Air Conditioning Unit is noisy.....”
Reviews.Author: RelaisAndChateau
Reviews.Content: Typical solid stay except for noisy air conditioning unit. It was loud tobegin with and became louder each time the compressors went on to cool the room. Made sleeping a chore.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel, freindly staff”
Reviews.Author: ALTX01
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while attending a trade show in Orlando. The front desk staff was very helpful and always smiling, specially Brian and Patricia. Very spacious and clean room, good bathroom. The hotel is a short drive from the convention center, or one can take the green trolley for a charge. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Orlando convnetion center / Seaworld area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend Christmas”
Reviews.Author: Richy_m_99
Reviews.Content: Looking for a place to spend Christmas, a time of year that I tend not enjoy that much, this year I decided to head for the sunnier climate of Orlando. Having a car available, a central location was not a prime concern, so the Garden Inn looked a perfect choice. Although not exactly in the hub of International Drive, the major interstates are close by giving access to all the Orlando and Kissimee theme parks as well as Kennedy and Busch Gardens in Tampa. First impressions are that the hotel is out of the way. From the I580, you have to drive about a mile down Westwood Boulevard which is mostly offices and hotels . You won't find any of the bars and restaurants close by that you would expect staying further up International Drive. The hotel is next to the Radisson, which is a lot easier to spot when driving, especially in the dark. Easiest access is off Academic Drive between the Radisson and Graden Inn. The exterior is tidy, well kept and the hotel has a large free car park, something that not every hotel in Orlando has. For those without transport, shuttles are available to and from the airport and all of the major theme parks. A regular trolley service operates to and from the more heavily populated parts of International Drive if you want to go out for the evening. Before arriving, I had done my homework and found that the better rooms are at the rear of the hotel, which overlook Seaworld. These are the odd numbered rooms. I had phoned reservations the day before and asked for, if possible, a room on that side on floors 7 or 8 (the tops floors). On arrival, I was allocated an even number room on floor 4, but on querying the allocation, the reception was happy to reallocate me to room 709, a king non smoking room. The rooms are well laid out, spacious and light, with good quality fixtures and fittings. The bed was extremely comfortable, and offers the ability to vary the softness/firmness of the matress to suit your own tastes. There is a control for either side of the bed so a couple doesn't have to compromise. Every room is provided with a refridgerator and microwave, very useful if, like me, you prefer drinking tea to coffee. Coffee making facilities are provided in the room, but not tea making, The ability to boil water in the microwave for tea more than makes up for it though. The bathroom fittings are of the same high standard as those in the bedroom. Water pressure was excellent, dispite being near the top of the building, and there was always plenty of hot water on demand. A small range of toiletries were topped up each day as requried. For rest and relaxation in the room, wi-fi is provided free of charge throughout the hotel. TV sports about 30 channels, including the majority of the favourite free to air entertainment and sports channels. Air conditioning is controlled via a thermostat on the wall, so you can set the temperature of the room in the morning and leave it for when your return at night. For dinings, the hotel offers a bar area which serves food and drink until 2300 at night. The menu is the same as the restaurant, which is open until 2200 at night for those heer prefer to dine more formally. Room service can be ordered until 2300 from the restaurant menu, a 20% surcharge replacing the normal fixed service charge. Breakfast is not normally included in the room rate, but is available every morning from 6.30 offering a range of hot and cold buffet food, omelettes cooked to order as well as savories for the sweet toothed ones. There is a set cost of $12.50. Other facilities provided by the hotel include a small gym/workout area, heating outdoor swimming pool and hot tub, a 24 hour store for small grocery items/personal items/soap etc and and two launderies (great if like me you travel light). The main selling pont of the hotel is it's proximity and links to Seaworld. The theme park entrance is between a 15 and 20 minute walk from the hotel. Just walk down Academic Drive at the side of the hotel, cross Sea Harbor Drive and walk diagonally across the car park to your left to get to the main gate. As well as selling entrance tickets, hotel residents are entitled to "front of queue" priority passes, essential if you want to ride the coasters. Useful to remember is that combination tickets are available for Seaworld, Aquatica and Busch Gardens, and all tickets are valid for unlimited access to the parks for 14 days from your first visit. I you do have a room overlooking Seaworld, don't miss the fireworks display just before closing each night. Also on the recommended list for first time visitors to Orlando is a trip out to Kennedy Space Centre on Merritt Island. About a 50 minute drive from Orlando, it provides a comprehensive look at the American Space Program, past, present and future. Their new tour, Kennedy Up Close is highly recommended, since for the first time it allows visitor inside the huge vehicle assembly buildings where the massive Apollo rockets, and laterly, the space shuttle were assembled. The shuttle orbiter Endeavour is being stored in there at present, and visitor can get within 10 yards of it for photographs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: plcitv
Reviews.Content: The good: Clean room with mini fridge and microwave. Free parking and wireless internet. Short drive to Disney World. You can see Sea World from the hotel - we didn't go to this park so I don't know if walking to Sea World is an option. Pillows of different thicknesses - doesn't seem like a big thing, but my wife likes thick pillows and I prefer thin. Also, no resort fees like a lot of the hotels in the area. Price is very reasonable based on room quality and breakfast value. For an extra $5 per adult, you get a full breakfast (lots of selection - made to order eggs, selection of fruit, make-your-own-waffles, bacon, sausage, french toast) - plus kids under 12 eat free. Breakfast was great and a good time and money-saver. Hotel has a mini-store with cold beer, other drinks, snacks, and toiletries. All of the staff is very courteous and gracious. Patricia - front desk staff from Haiti was a delight. Very kind. Gave my daughter a stuffed animal. The bad: The hotel advertises a heated pool. We tried using the pool, but the water was too cold and the hot tub was too hot, so we chose to leave the hotel a couple of days early and move to another hotel with an indoor pool (Ramada Maingate West). Hotel restaurant only available for breakfast and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: georgie6767
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were only staying 1 night, we arrived christmas morning at 11 am and were very grateful when they found a clean room for us straightaway. The welcome from the front desk was excellent and they seemed to genuinely aim to please. It is 5 min walk to seaworld but for us the best thing was the added bonus of having quick queue given free for all 4 of us, (although you have to go to the nearby renaissance to reserve your passes.) This represents fantastic value for money and allowed us to ride all day without queing. My only negative of the room is the lack of safe because the safety boxes at front desk do not hold much.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out Disney....exceeded customer expectations for service”
Reviews.Author: franbeach
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Orlando a day earlier then anticipated as we were driving from Canada and had no idea that Orlando was a sold out town with many events going on from soccer games,bowl game events and marathon weekend. We started looking for a room and were turned down by many other big name hotel chains and their front desk personal would not even phone other hotels in their chain to try and locate a room for us. One hotel even try to scam us with a price for a room written on a piece of paper and slid across the desk to us. We were not that desperate so the search took us to the Hilton Garden Inn at SeaWorld. The front desk despite many numbers of people checking in took the time to phone around to their sister hotels and in the end were able to locate us in their hotel at the normal price!!!The room was clean/excellent bed, well equipped room and no charge for parking which many of the area hotels were doing just for this busy week of events. This hotel is in a great location to all major theme parks and shopping and excellent value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for holiday!”
Reviews.Author: hatzer_juergen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hilton garden inn for 5 days. Nice hotel and one of the cleanest at our florida cruise. The hotel is perfect for a "theme-park-tour". While we are stay at this hotel, we looked at universal studios, magic kingdom, sea world and busch gardens. For sea world and busch gardens you can buy cheap tickets at the information desk. The pool is small, but ok. The water always was in a good temperature and very clean. Greets from austria

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtnblueberrie
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the spur of the moment while driving in the area and checking for reasonably priced hotels with great ratings on Trip Advisor's app. Check in was a breeze, the location was great, and the room was excellent and very clean. We only stayed one night and didn't use the restaurant or any of the other services, but we will definitely stay again when we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business and Tourist hotel and great location. Here is the scoop !”
Reviews.Author: Grouperboy
Reviews.Content: First of all I saw my first negative review of this property and I must say this hotel has the least negative reviews I have read in Orlando. True if I want to stay at a hotel with a $300 room rate it should have none at all. Here is the truth about this hotel. It has perfect parking and the fasted elevators I have ever used. The room has a great LCD TV and the microwave and Refridgerator are useful. The bed is comfortable and the noise level is perfect. The internet is up to Hilton standards and the GM, front desk folks, bartender, and very pretty slender dark haired server is very nice as well as all the restaurant folks. The food was very nice and had a great selection to choose from. The only complaint I have is the phone has some static and one needed a little adjusting to make it work. Not a big deal. The pool is very nice and has a very nice feel to it with the bar steps away. Now if you want noisy lobbies, lots of activity with tourists, difficult parking, and lots of traffic to deal with than there are lot's of those hotels to choose from. Also when a hotel is running 100% percent occupancy it will have some issues but even this hotel when it was full was running smooth. It was my 2nd stay by the way and they put me in the same room. A corner on the 7th floor... Get your room type confirmed before you get there. Book on the Hilton website and request what you want. Join the Hilton Honors club and I will assure you you will not have any major problems. And if you do the GM Michael will go out of his way to make things right. He is a true professional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renee L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days while visiting Disney World and I was more than satisfied with this hotel. It was REALLY clean and well staffed. We got a GREAT deal online for $69 per night. The beds were comfortable and the room came with a fridge and microwave. Free coffee in the morning and cookies in the evening. The bathroom was well stocked and very clean. Only about 10 minute drive to the parks. The only problem I had was we were on the 8th floor and there was a loud whirring or similar sound randomly happening at night. Did not know if it was the elevator or planes? We slept through it okay. Recommended and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more based on reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Terry M
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a lot more based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. We stayed from Dec 7 to Dec 12, 2011. We requested Non-Smoking and King Size Bed. When we checked in, we were advised this type room wasn't available. We could choose Smoking/King or Non-Smoking/2xDoubles. Not happy but fine okay, we did check in late. I called front desk next morning and requested they reserve the room we originally chose and she was happy to do so. We just had to pack up our luggage and they would move it to our new room while we were out. After a long day, we got back to the hotel and I asked for our new key cards for the new room and I was disappointed nothing had been done and we were still stuck with a room we didn't want! The guy at front desk apologized and said he would look into why this happened. He didn't really say or do anything to make me happy as this was the 2nd night of our 4 night stay without the room we requested. He did offer us a breakfast voucher which we used the following morning... ...Breakfast buffet at the Hilton Garden Inn at SeaWorld was pretty aweful. Our glasses were not clean! They had lip marks and looked like it had juice residue on them still! This turned us off right away! I've been to quite a few hotel breakfasts of this style, and this was one of the worst in terms of quality of cooked foods. On our 3rd night that we finally got our requested room. Let me talk about the cleanliness of both rooms we stayed in. VERY DISAPPOINTING! Bathrooms tiles and grout were disgustingly stained. Shower curtains looked like they should have been replaced ages ago. We found a disgusting bandaid on the floor between the wall and night table. It's probably still there as it was never cleaned up during our stay. Carpets were dirty and need a good deep cleaning. Very unimpressive rooms that looked aged, dirty, worn out, and discolored. Free internet and free parking was nice but overall I'm very displeased with our stay here. I would not stay here ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay & so close to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: mlhsnb
Reviews.Content: Impressed by this hotel and fantastic front desk staff! Our stay exceeded my expectations. The front desk was able to provide excellent recommendations for dining, shopping and transportation! Patricia was superb - very friendly and extremely helpful! The hotel is close to SeaWorld, a short walk out the door and is also right on the trolley line with several stops, which made getting around very easy. Everything was clean and inviting!

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: shegouch
Reviews.Content: Service was great staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was fantastic clean & comfy I slept better here then at home the bed was that good. The price and location could not be beaten. walking distance from Sea World. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet waiters and staff very nice. Next time I'm in Orlando I will plan to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: Hoops2441
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 11/23/11 to 11/27/11. The Good: The hotel was easy to find and easy to get to and from. Check in and check out went very smoothly. The hotel had everything in order and checked us in and out very quickly. The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful with any questions we asked. We ordered room service late one night and were told it would take 25 minutes. The food arrived in about fifteen minutes which was a nice surprise. The bed was very comfortable and I got a good nights sleep each night. The Bad: The room was not very impressive. One part of the wall had been obviously repainted and the color didn't even come close to matching the original color. The shower head in the shower was about chest high making washing of hair difficult. The shower floor was very high (I think for plumbing underneath) however this left little room to have a reasonably high shower head. The Ugly: The housekeeping service was obviously done by someone who didn't really care about their job. One day the trash was not emptied in the bathroom. Another day the trash was emptied in the room however the bag was not replaced leaving a trash can that was rusty and nasty inside. We had set 3 cans and bottles by the trash can and only two were taken away. The trash can at one point was left near the center of the room (obiously not returned to its location after being emptied). We did leave a $2-$3 tip each day and got this type of service (I understand $3 is not a lot of money however expected better service even without a tip). The bathroom shower was very dirty looking. I don't think it was actually dirty just old and worn down. The comforter on the bed looked like it had been used for 10 years. Instead of having an even thickness the filling was clumped up in many different places. The sheets came off one corner of the bed one day to reveal a very nasty looking stain on the side of the mattress. It looked like someone had been murdered against the side of the bed. Overall I would not recommend this hotel due to the fact that there are about a million hotels in the Orlando area. The price was reasonable however I think compared to others in the area better deals can easily be found. Maybe I just got a bad room but I wouldn't come back. I did not bring these issues to management so I am not sure how they would have responded. The issues came up over the course of several days and not all at once which was not enough to make me complain. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at good rate.”
Reviews.Author: JB222Chicago
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent prepaid rate the weekend before Thanksgiving. Able to check in early with no problem. Had a King room, which is on the small side, but acceptable for a couple staying only 2 nights. Air conditioner is a bit noisy, but that's about the only complaint. I'd stay again if visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn at Sea World”
Reviews.Author: ABC-DVC
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in July as a mini family reunion. I was thoroughly impressed with the Hilton Garden Inn at Sea World. Their staff was extremely knowledgable and courteous to everyone. The rooms were much roomier and quiet than expected. There was a large tour group also staying in our hotel, but the hotel staff did a great job of isolating them to the lower floors, allowing the families like myself to have the higher, preferred rooms. In fact, we hardly noticed this group. We had a perfect view of the Sea World fireworks, which the kids loved. In addition to the clean, well maintained rooms, there were many perks that we didn't realize until we checked in. The best perk was the pass that allowed us to jump to the head of the line at the major attractions in Sea World. That is worth staying at this hotel again. What a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rock712
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Hilton Garden Seaworld for 3 nights , and overall it was a great experience and would defintely stay again and recommend to others. I'll get my personal negatives out of the way first. Bathroom was a little on the small side , sink,toilet, and shower all in one space, and the bed was very soft. Both of these things though are based on personal preferences , and not the fault of Hilton. The bathroom was well kept and very neat and my wife claims if I had my way I'd sleep on a slab of concrete Putting those two little things aside , I'd rate this place as outstanding in every way. You couldnt ask for a better location. 2 minutes off of I-4, 10 minute walk to Seaworld( save the $$$ on parking ) , 5-10 minute drive to all Disney parks, Universal , and all attraction and restaurants on I-Drive All staff encountered very helpful and friendly. Housekeeping very efficient, room was spotless every day when we returned. As far as price , paid $90 for a two room,king bed suite, and believe me , I've paid a lot more for a lot less at other places. Used Hiltons on line site to book and was very efficient and easy to use

Reviews.Title: “What A Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn at Sea World had everything I neded: great SPOTLESS room, service, and courteous staff. I've paid twice the price and haven't gotten as much for my money. The restaurant has a great breakfast, nice sandwiches and hearty entrees. I really appreicated this since I just wanted to chill out after my all day classes. When I wanted a change I walked one block to the CVS and picked up a frozen entree and some popcorn for the microwave. The airport shuttle came to the hotel, so I really didn't need a car. There was plenty of hot water, the bed was comfortable with a variety of pillows, and there were plenty of channels on the TV.Oh, did I mention the use of two FREE computers near the front desk? My meeting hotel wanted $6.00 for ten minutes! I think not! And the complimentary evening cookies were quite tasty! :)

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: NelsonFam5
Reviews.Content: My family has an annual pass for SeaWorld this year...we've tried a handful of hotels in the area and have come to this conclusion- The Hilton Garden Inn is the place to be! The rooms are clean & comfortable, but the staff is what makes this place great. From check-in, to the concierge, to the LOVELY staff in the dining area, every person we've come into contact with has been gracious & accomodating. The price is reasonable &, the location is perfect (walking distance from the park)- we have found our place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best bargain in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Arvrim
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn at Sea World is the best bargain in Orlando. The location is perfect with walking distance to Sea World and CVS right in the corner. The International Drive attractions are 5 min distance by car. You can take the trolley to theme parks in front of the hotel. The rooms have good size, equipped with iron, hairdryer, fridge, cofee maker and microwave.Good cleaning and all the facilities for perfect vacation in Orlando. On the next visit I will be back at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bruce Z
Reviews.Content: I attended the same conference next door at the Renaissance Orlando. The Hilton Garden Inn was half the price ($84 per night), and Andrea, who checked me in, let me upgrade to a B&B package for $4/meal per day. The staff was friendly and courteous. Although normal late checkout is an hour or two later at most hotels, Andrea came through with a much later checkout at 2:30. I'm sure it was because it was a Sunday. Even though we did not have a car with us, the parking was free. Next door, our conference rate for parking was $15 self park. Really - how can you charge for parking around here!?! Especially at a resort that you're already paying top-dollar for. Internet was also free at the HIlton. All in all, a very comfortable stay. If you're coming to the Orlando parks, it was a great deal compared to most of the other places in the area and literally across the street from SeaWorld. All in all - ditto to Todd B, Paton_Scott and GRGADA's posts.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: paton_scott
Reviews.Content: Not the fanciest or most modern looking of hotels, but it was a great stay. As mentioned in previous reviews the staff are really friendly and will help you out any way they can. Standard room, decent size, air con is a tad loud but does make the room nice an cool. Buffet style breakfast, although staff do bring coffee/tea and OJ. Location is a wierd one for anywhere on international drive as it is so long, we had no idea it was such a distance from one end to the other. The hotel itself is great for sea world and discovery cove, easily walking distance for sea world, discovery cove is about 5 minutes drive at most from sea world. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel where you can get the bus that goes all the way along i-drive, the bus service was quite poor and it would cost far too much to get taxis everywhere, alot of times we waited more than 20 minutes for a bus only to see one go past with the FULL sign on-THIS OBVIOUSLY CANT BE COUNTED AGAINST THE HOTEL, just that it relates to the location thing, although renting a car would cancel this out. As most people will be going to discovery cove/sea world/busch gardens/disney world, the location is fantastic. At night we mostly got the i-ride bus down a few stops to a busy area with restaurants, bars, then taxi back which after tip was generally less than $15.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Todd B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days for a conference. The hotel staff were the nicest people I've ever met in a hotel staff. Every need we had was taken care of. The daily breakfasts were unbelievably delicious and made to order at that! It was a great experience and the front desk greeters of Andrea and staff made you feel at home every time you walked in the door!!

Reviews.Title: “vacations”
Reviews.Author: carlos m
Reviews.Content: we stay for 3 nights, the locations was great right in front of sea world park, the service was great, we have complementary breakfast, free parking they have a bus take u to the park, the first day they give us a room with two queen beds and I come back to the loby and they give me the room we want, nex time we go to Orlando we will come back to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Luis D
Reviews.Content: All started with A++ Service at the front desk with Andrea to very clean rooms. Great Location since its location is ideal.. you are between Universal and Disney and right across from Sea World, and located in Internal Drive.. Thanks for the staffs help! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for business @ Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Shayne S
Reviews.Content: Very clean, staff was very nice and helpful, & close to the convention center where I had to be for my 2 days there. Also seemed very close to alot of restaurants and such.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: Atlcorsa
Reviews.Content: If your going to Sea World there is no better place.to stay! We were welcomed at the front desk as return guest as warmly as family. When they learned we wouldn't be there in the evening they placed the fresh cookies in our room. The room was clean and offered a.few of Sea World. They even have.free fast pass.for.Sea.World. Breakfast was aldo really good. Free shuttle to the park. Just a.great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenent for attactions”
Reviews.Author: TravelDaveT
Reviews.Content: A very convenent location for the major attractions. The hotel staff were very helpful, standard hot buffet breakfast: eggs, bacon,cereal etc. Hotel a little dated but still very well cared for,very clean rooms and pool area. Would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BlooBunnie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 9/25 to 9/30 for a vacation to Universal Studios, Disney World, and SeaWorld. My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Garden Inn. All the employees who worked the front desk during our stay were wonderful and extremely helpful. They answered all our questions and were friendly no matter the time of day. There is also an Expedia local expert stationed at a desk by the front entrance and all the experts that we encountered were very friendly and knowledgable as well. The hotel was very clean, well kept, and has eight floors. We were given a room on the eighth floor facing the front of the hotel. The room was large and roomy. There was a king bed with two night stands, an alarm clock, a sitting chair with small coffee table, a writing desk with a nice ergonomic chair, a large flat screen TV atop a dresser, a fridge and a microwave. The bathroom was roomy as well and was very clean. There is a nice sized closet with an iron and ironing board. The room was very quiet. There are no safes in the rooms. Instead, there are safes by the front desk. They give you a key in order to lock up your valuables. Yours is the only key that opens the lock. So I would say, don't worry about security as I used the safe and everything was fine and this is coming from someone who was very hesitant to leave my stuff by the front desk. We didn't use the pool or gym so I can't comment on those areas. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night and had the pizza special - $19.95 for a large pizza, 2 liter coke product and buffalo wings. A great deal. The service at the restaurant was excellent. The waitress was accommodating and friendly. The employees we encountered at this hotel really were just great. You couldn't ask for better staff. The only problem we ever had was with someone we never encountered - the housekeeping staff that cleaned our room. We came back to the room one night to find that our trash can had not been emptied of trash which was disconcerting seeing as how we had left a tip on the bed for housekeeping. We also didn't receive a newspaper during our stay except for our first and last day, meanwhile we saw other rooms received a paper daily. Other than housekeeping, we thought the hotel staff was great. Every morning by the front desk, they have complimentary coffee and tea for guests and at night by the front desk they put out free cookies for guests. The hotel provides complimentary shuttle service to Universal Studios, Disney World, and SeaWorld. There are specific times when you can catch these shuttles. The hotel's Disney shuttle drops you off at Epcot and from there you can hop onto an official Disney shuttle to get to the other Disney theme parks. You have to then return to Epcot to get picked up for the return to the hotel. It might sound difficult but it was fine and pretty convenient. The hotel shuttles to Universal and SeaWorld were great - convenient pick up and return times and large comfortable shuttles. The hotel shuttle to Disney though was a different story. The hotel's Disney shuttle is a shuttle run by a company called Crown City. It picks people up from other hotels before it arrives at the Hilton Garden Inn and is a much smaller shuttle. Once it arrives at the Hilton, it's already packed and is standing room only. If you're lucky enough to get a seat, you may find yourself wondering who built the shuttle. Apparently whoever built it didn't think people would need leg room because from the back of one seat to the seat behind it, there is about 1 inch of leg room and sadly that is not an exaggeration. From the Hilton it traveled to two other hotels before it finally arrived at Disney. The week we stayed at the hotel, the return times to the hotel were 6:40pm and 10:00pm. Who decided on these return times?! Magic Kingdom closed at 7:00pm and Epcot closed at 9:00pm while we were there. A 6:40pm pick up time cheats you out of time at both parks and the 10:00pm pick up time left you standing in a parking lot for an hour after the park closed waiting for a shuttle. The 10:00 shuttle was always packed and it was always standing room only. The driver always arrived past 10:00 and there was always a lone woman sitting in the front. Who was this mysterious woman and where did the driver pick her up from? Hmm could it be that she was the reason he was always late? She took up a seat that could have gone to a hotel guest. Apparently the week prior, there was a 9:20pm return time ... wish they would have kept that time for the week we were there. There is a CVS located across the street from the hotel which was very convenient. You can pick up water, snacks, and anything else you might have forgotten. We bought rain ponchos from there when we heard it was going to rain one day. The ponchos really saved us when it started to pour at Universal. The CVS is open 24 hours. If you're going to order in, we ordered from Flipper's Pizza and it was pretty good. Their prices are reasonable and delivery was fast. The toppings were very fresh and the pizza was good. Once they arrive at the hotel, the front desk gives you a call and you go down to the lobby to pick up the pizza. So, all in all a good hotel with great staff. If housekeeping and the Disney shuttle were better, then the hotel would've been excellent. We did enjoy our stay overall though and would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: MyZenworks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the Hilton Garden inn for a convention. The price was better than most over-priced hotels in the Sea World area or Orange county convention area. The food was very good for low to mid range hotel in the Hilton brand. We had bomb-scare-- presumably the same one as the other reviewers. We were not well informed about the situation except the sheriff located right across the street blocked our entry back to the hotel after leaving the convention center. We were hoping for a good night sleep. Nope... We were directed to go the Renaissance hotel next door. Here is where we found other Hilton hotel guest. We ate dinner at the hotel and the meal was compensated "Comp" by the Hilton garden inn. At first, they were told to only comp a drink, but we finally had them comp the meal which we would have expected from the Hilton brand. We also booked a room at the Renaissance for the night. The Hilton garden inn did remove the night we did not stay due to the bomb-scare. As a Hilton diamond member I expect problems while traveling on business. It is very unfortunate families or couples experienced this disruption to their stay in the magic kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: catladysue
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. The bed was exceptionally comforable. They even had movie night out by the pool for the kids. Pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Evacuation Sunday September 18th”
Reviews.Author: dstoffer
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to take a moment & Thank the Hilton Garden Inn Management & Staff for the way they handled the situation that occured on Sunday Septemebr 18th... It was nice to see a Hotel do the right thing & make sure the safety of the guests were put first. ( Especailly when traveling w/ young children )... The comp of the food & drinks during this period showed a touch of class & again was appreciated. Thank you again for making this trip another memorable stay & we look forward too many more visits while visiting the Orlando area. The Stoffer Family Marietta, GA

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not care about its guests, only your money.”
Reviews.Author: Amelia H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel when we had to be evacuated due to the "suspicious package" in the lobby/bomb threat. I knew nothing about the package or the fact that we were going to be evacuated until the moment when the sheriff pounded on my door and scared the living daylights out of me. I had no idea WHY we were being evacuated and there was NO staff member around to help answer questions or even reassure its guests. We were just told to walk to the hotel across the road........in the dark. There was no transport available, we had no idea what was going on, when we could return to our rooms or what we were supposed to do for the next - turned out to be four - hours in the other hotel lobby. WHERE was the manager or anyone in charge during this?!?!?!! When we arrived in the hotel, there was no briefing to the guests, I was scared but there was no staff member of the Hilton Garden Inn to answer my questions. I am not even sure if the hotel accounted for every guest's whereabouts during the evacuation, and the staff left BEFORE the guests! This is what a decent hotel (staff) would do: - Inform guests about the evacuation before leaving the hotel first (and refusing to answer the lobby phone) - Gather guests in the lobby of the other hotel and let us know what's going on - this is common sense! - REASSURE US - Tell us the plan of action and promise to update us. This hotel did NONE of the above. They left everyone to their own devices, they did not take care of their guests at all. We didn't even know when we could return to our rooms! Or if it was safe enough to! We just followed each other back to the hotel and hoped they would let us in. This hotel does not care about the safety of its guests - in fact, this hotel just does not care about their guests. They want your money. I second the review below me, I will never stay here again. Never.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nigelfromkent
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the HGI Seaworld and once again we were delighted.We stayed for 21 nights in August. The room was spotless and we were given the seaworld view we had requested when we booked which meant we could see the fireworks each night from our window. The staff at this hotel are absolutely the friendliest we have encountered anywhere. Many of them recognised from our previous stays which was really nice. William, Jose and Pillar made breakfast enjoyable every morning - even when the hotel was at full capacity and the restaurant was really busy they made time to make us feel special. Christy was also great in the restaurant and bar in the evenings - nothing was too much trouble. Special mention to Mike and Gary for looking after us so well on our wedding anniversary -. Coming back to our room in the evening after a long, hot day at the parks to find a bottle of bubbly on ice and some cold beers waiting was an unexpected delight and truly appreciated. I think it is a testament to the way the hotel is run that so many of the team have worked there so long. There is a real family atmosphere amongst the staff and they really do go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as they can. With the combined cost of flights and theme park tickets getting more expensive every year, we have to certain that we are going to have a clean, comfortable and enjoyable stay when we come to Florida. We can always rely on the Hilton Garden Inn at Seaworld to come up trumps every time. The hotel is not only great in every way but also exceptional value for money. With breakfast included in our room rate and the the complimentary Quick queue passes for Seaworld this hotel has got to be one of the best options for anyone looking for a central base in the Orlando area. We would recommend this hotel to anyone without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “They did a good job. Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Bill707
Reviews.Content: and breakfast was included. Order your pizza from Flippers and pick it up in the lobby, it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: JMGBarcelona
Reviews.Content: Stayed there six days while visiting the parks. It's close to pretty much everything: water parks, Disney and International Drive. Rooms are nice and well maintained and breakfast has better quality than standards Staff at the front desk was very helpful and friendly, however staff at the restaurant for breakfast, specially managers not so nice and more concerned about tips than service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton Hotel On A Budget.”
Reviews.Author: Vader1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on 23rd August for 1wk as the reviews were good enough for us to stay here. The hotel is a 'budget' hilton and it did not disappoint us! Room is very clean and met our needs for the duration of the stay. We initially had a room at the front of the building but asked the next day if there was a room at the rear facing Seaworld. Patricia at the front desk sorted this out for us with no problems at all. Unfortunately for us there was no fireworks going on in the evening at Seaworld for us to look out at! :-( We had the free breakfast buffet that had a good selection and the chef was happy to cook to order for you which is nice. The hotel even has a free film showing by the pool on seleted Friday evenings which is good. Even better as the hotel is a 'seaworld' partner, you can pickup free 'quick-queue' tickets for all the rides at Seaworld which is a big plus and the free courtesy bus to Seaworld & Aquatica saved us on money and time. Overall we enjoyed our stay here and there is nothing negative that I could say for the reasonable price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Large, beautiful room - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Synsiya
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay on our trip to Orlando. The room was huge! There was a full kitchen, living room, seperate bedroom with jacuzzi tub and a shower stall in the washroom. It was clean and tidy. There is a great pool there for hanging out and the drinks are great. the only thing that sucks here is breakfast. Breakfast was $12 (which we thought was a deal for a hotel) however the service was poor, the food was cold and tasteless. We could've drove to the strip and got a much better/bigger breakfast for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, handy location”
Reviews.Author: MisseySWorcester
Reviews.Content: Loved the Food Hotel Room was big & clean (a little tired on the paintwork side) staff were very friendly made us feel very welcome. Free transport to Seaworld, Universal Studios and Epcot each day - just book in the loby Nice pool - a little small but it did the trick Handy 7/11 shop very close to Hotel it was handy for snacks and drinks etc. Most undersold resturant - food was amazing for dinner and well worth a meal we loved the anchoves with cheese dip - OMG it was amazing! Well done guys hope to see you all again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, property and value.”
Reviews.Author: D_Auterson
Reviews.Content: Typical HGI property with nice, well equipped rooms, friendly staff and good restaurant. This particular hotel is very close to attractions, I-Drive and the many activities that draw so many to Orlando. But, it felt removed from the business and crowding common to other properties - especially those along I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “very good but in the dark”
Reviews.Author: TheyoungonesNOT
Reviews.Content: First the bad: If you want to sunbathe around the pool in the morning, tough as the pool doesn't get the sun until mid-day. The fitness room has nothing for strength training other than a couple of 5kg handbells even though it advertises it has a full range of weights. The air-conditioning was noisy. Now the good: This is a nice, clean hotel that is goodvalue. The location at the quiet end of I-Drive is perfect and has road links to all the attractions and motorways. The breakfast is very good with an good range of hot and cold food. The table staff argue constantly which turns it into a pantomine worth seeing. The greatest quality of this hotel is that it probably has the friendliest staff of any other hotel in Orlando. Every employee goes out of their way to help and this makes it stand out above other hotels. Four stars but would have been five if the fool that designed this hotel had put the pool in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to go Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Mefa2003
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (our kids are 8 and 11 years old) went to Orlando to visit Sea World. We had a bedroom suite with 2 double beds in one room and a large living room. Each room had its own TV and you could close the door between the rooms. The breakfast was not included in our room rate but it was very good and well worth the price. Upon our arrival in the afternoon we went to the well equipped business center and bought our Sea World tickets online. If you buy your tickets at Sea Worlds website you get a second day for free and adult tickets cost just as much as child tickets (as of July 2011) Afterwards we got our free Quick Queue passes at the Expedia Travel Desk in the lobby and walked to Sea World for the evening. Quick-Queue (normally $29.99/person/day) is great if you want to go on the rides. Very few people had a pass so we got on the rides with almost no waiting time. (And over and over again) The pass also includes one complimentary ride on Paddle Boats and Skytower (another saving of ca. $10/person/day) As the Quick-Queue passes are for one day only we had to go to the Travel Desk in the lobby early next morning to get new passes. Sea World is very close. It takes only 5 minutes to get to their parking lot and then another 5 - 10 minutes to get to the front gate. It is great to be so close. We returned to our room in the afternoon to rest and went to the pool as well. We had early dinner at the hotel restaurant and went back to Sea World in the evening. With Quick-Queue passes for 2 days we had additional free benefits of over $280 for the 4 of us which makes this Hotel the best stay for Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Yunquemarsita
