Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel from 08/09-08/15 and had a wonderful time. It was the friendliest and most helpful staff we encountered during our entire trip. (every other service-orientated places, rest. parks, etc most people were generally nasty). The rooms were great, we saw fireworks each night and could so easily walk to SeaWorld. The expedia concierge was also very helpful. Especially outstanding were our server William at Breakfast, Tiffani at Concierge, Raymond (I think - Night Manager), and the unseen faces of Housekeeping who were very good at leaving everything in order. They deserve 5 stars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MCPO-USN-2011
Reviews.Content: Not a newer property, but a very well maintained property. Staff is excellent and always accomodating. LOCATION: The property is considered a Sea World accomodation (see benefits paragraph below) - and is adjacent to the entrance to Sea World. It is easy-on-easy-off from I-4, and is close enough to supermarkets and every dining possibility. And, most importantly, it is away from the International Blvd madness (stay away from that bottleneck between the hours of 3pm and 10pm---esp in the evening). SEA WORLD SHUTTLE: Do *not* waste your time with this.....it took us 32min to ride from the hotel to the main gate of Sea World.....because it stops at Doubletree and Aquatica prior to Sea World......the bus is crammed-standing-room-only, and just is to much of a hassle. TRUST ME (and Zacharey from the Expedia Travel Desk in the lobby), the main gate is 11.5 minutes from the hotel (I timed it coming back to the hotel....only rode the shuttle to the park). Walk to the park.....it is easy and hassle free. BENEFITS: Staying on property gives you cetain benefits: Free Quick-Queue (normally $29.99/person) - this allows you head of the line and free admission to the tower and paddle boats. They also give you a 10% discount card. Add those two things, along with saving $15.00 for parking - - and staying here pays for itself with the benefits. In order to get the 10% card and the Quick Queue, you must check-in with the Expedia Travel Desk in the lobby, prior to leaving for the park. The Expedia Desk opens at 7am (I got there at 6:45am, and was the first in line). After 7:01am, the line becomes very long and time consuming.....so, be early. ROOM: We had a 1-BDRM SUITE (2 BEDS/SOFA BED) - - rooms are not huge, but were more than comfortable for my family of 5. The bathroom is a bit "ehh" small.....but, we managed. Microwave and fridge in room. POOL: Fun pool (no slide, not a "resort" pool), but large enough for the guests and open late (11pm). FOOD: There is a bar (not bad) and a full menu restaraunt. Breakfast was really good and included in our room rate (Military rate)......however, I believe that normally breakfast is not free. There is a small mini-mart in the lobby. Overall, there was nothing negative about our stay. We stayed 2 nights, checked in early on our first day, and never had a complaint or problem. The easy access to Sea World and all the cost-saving extras made this hotel the best place to stay (for Sea World).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: mscallieco
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to visit SeaWorld with my grandson and found the location excellent and very convenient. It is also close to I-4 and International Drive. It took us about 15 minutes to walk to the front gate at SeaWorld although they offered a shuttle with a variety of pick up and drop off times as well as a shuttle to Aquatica. They have more limited shuttle times to the other major theme parks. We had a 1 bedroom suite which was on the small side but more than adequate for our needs. Check in and out was very efficient. Front desk were helpful in explaining benefits of staying there as they are a SeaWorld partner hotel including the quick cue passes. We cut our trip short and returned home early due to the rainy weather but will stay there again if the rate is the same on our next visit to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, price also.”
Reviews.Author: Kees63
Reviews.Content: Just a perfect hotel at a perfect place. For à very nice price. You can walk to SeaWorld. And even to Aquatica. That will save you $15 on parking costs. You can even use the free bus to the location, although it isn't driving very often. The rooms are quit good. The people at the reception can use à little class for kindness. There are not very much people eating at the hotel. So in THE evening it 's a little boring at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: ARTLinda
Reviews.Content: We take mini trips frequently and this time we decided to stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Orlando. It was probably the nicest hotel we have stayed in in the last few years and at a really reasonable price for Orlando. It provided free, timely shuttle service to all of the local attractions; Disney. Sea World, etc. It was exceptionally clean and the staff, from the front desk to the service people we friendly and made the stay a pleasure. Everybody went out of their way to give you great service. As an extra at night (if you have a room that faces Sea World) you get a free 20 minute 4th of July like fireworks show display during the summer months (don't know about winter). Sea World is less than a 1/4 mile away. Pool was large and kept up well. Walking distance to a CVS. Restaurant in the hotel and many close about a mile or two away. When trying to use the ration scale below if you hit excellent all of the dots blacken in from terrible to excellent. I assure you all of my ratings would be excellent except the kids activities which I am not sure about. So, if you see all dots blackened it should read excellent in all categories. No terrible experiences in this hotel. All in all this will be our first choice hotel in the Orlando area. We will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay for Seaworld and Aquatica and surrounding parks”
Reviews.Author: kdsdelray
Reviews.Content: great hotel- the rooms and surrounding areas including the pool were clean- the staff was very welcoming and helpful. We had drinks and a steak sandwich in the bar- also breakfast in the restaurant- all very good. The proximity to Seaworld and Aquatica was so convenient- we will definitely stay here again when we return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, most convenient to Sea World"”
Reviews.Author: tourgal21
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Friday evening in the midst of a terrible storm. The front desk person was very friendly and efficient. She had us on our way to our room very quickly so we could get to the meeting we were in town to attend. The room was very inviting, almost didn't want to go to the meeting. It was a King Room with a refrigerator and microwave. I am not big on Hilton's douvets, but this one was one of the better ones I have seen. The bed was very comfortable. The douvets are very heavy, but there was a blanket in the closet which we put on the bed along with an extra pillow. All in all the room was very nice. Extremely clean and the daily service was very good. This hotel had one of the largest swimming pools I have seen in new hotels. We had dinner the next night in the hotel restaurant and it was very good and the service was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return when in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: kmkehn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here with my family 3 times now in the past several years. This hotel is very clean, bright, comfortable, and convenient to SeaWorld/Aquatica/Discovery Cove. The rooms are basic, but have everything we need, including mini-fridge, microwave, small coffee maker. It has a small restaurant and a separate bar area, a pool, free parking (other nearby hotels charge daily parking fees), free internet, and you can buy tickets to any of the theme parks (incl. Disney, Universal, SeaWorld, etc.... in the lobby), which is way more convenient than doing it at the parks. The front desk usually has cookies for guests, as well as a free, quick coffee area so you don't have to go to the restaurant just for that. The room rates are fantastic considering the amenities. This hotel is also close to all the restaurants and smaller attractions (like museums & mini-golf) on International Drive. It's not walkable, but is a 5 minute drive. You can, however, walk to SeaWorld easily from here. Then from SeaWorld, take the park's free shuttle to Discovery Cove and/or Aquatica. If those parks are what you are there for, you will not have to drive at all if you don't want to. The hotel may have a free shuttle, we've just always walked, so I don't know. This will be our first choice for any return trips to Orlando. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel & location for Sea World”
Reviews.Author: AndyFWB
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel. Spacious rooms with fridge, good mattresses and overall rather new looking. Bathroom with tub. Sea World is within walking distance. (about 8 - 10 minutes) Complimentary parking and I-Ride trolley station across the street. Overall a recommendable hotel for tourists looking for a save, affordable yet clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “All smiles”
Reviews.Author: askinney
Reviews.Content: My son, daughter in-law and myself stayed here. It was perfect. Right across the street from Sea World. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was all smiles and very helpful! The beds were clean and comfortable. We are already making plans to stay again in the fall. My tip would be to be about 5 min early for the bus as they run on time in the morning and you don't want to miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: missraven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Orlando for three nights the last week of June for our mini-vacation to SeaWorld with our 4 year old daughter. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a very warm welcome by Patricia at the front desk. She was so lovely and extremely helpful the entire time, as were all of the other staff we encountered there! Honestly, I've never stayed in a hotel where each and every person who worked there was friendly, helpful and eager to take care of you. I am not exaggerating. We specifically chose this hotel because of its proximity to SeaWorld which was great (walking distance out the back, 5 minutes) and it was a suite room. The room was clean and comfortable and the King bed in the bedroom was superb! The only minor complaint which I really should have mentioned at the hotel, but totally forgot was the sofabed. Now, to be fair, sofabeds aren't great from the get-go but the sofabed mattress in the room we stayed in should probably be replaced. In any case, that is the only complaint I had. The food -- it was really good! And the staff in the restaurant top notch. We got a package with free breakfast and it was excellent. So many choices, you could even make your own waffles, which our little girl got a kick out of. Dinner was excellent too and again, the waitstaff so accommodating and friendly. I'm sorry, I really wish I could remember everyone's names because they were all wonderful. Truly, I cannot say enough good things about the place. We'll be back next year to go to SeaWorld again and Discovery Cove.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: caddy3
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 15th June and found a very warm welcome here. Our room was very nice although the air conditioning was rather noisy. We really enjoyed the pool and the temperature of the spa was perfect. Our son used one of the gym bags and found that really handy. Everything went really well and staff are so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Five nights for a family of three - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cape_cod_mamma
Reviews.Content: We had a bunch of Hilton points to spend and reservations at Discovery Cove and tickets for Aquatica - where to stay? I checked the reviews here and decided to give this property a try. We were not disappointed!!! Everything was great from the location, friendly check-in (Steven), nice restaurant, great breakfast, nice rooms, good pool...great for a family. There were also some nice extras such as the "dive in" movie night. Plus, a visit from Shamu and the Seaworld staff on Saturday morning was a real treat for our son. Andrea at the desk, and William, Jose and Ashley in the restaurant made each day a pleasure. The drive to Discovery Cove was 5 minutes - Aquatica, maybe 7 minutes. We could have walked to SeaWorld - it was that close. A free shuttle was provided, but we chose to drive. We walked to CVS for anything we needed. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we've ever experienced. International Drive was nearby. Downtown Disney about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: FoppaNguyen
Reviews.Content: It was my gf and mine's first trip to Orlando. We didn't know anything about the layout of the city or it's attractions. Luckily for us this hotel was conveniently located near everything we wanted to do. It's walking distance to SeaWorld, roughly 10-15 mins driving to two premium outlets (the ladies will love it), about 10 mins driving to Universal Studios, and about 20 mins to Disney World. The staff were very friendly, we asked a bunch of questions and they were very knowledgable and informative. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and the staff there was more than accomodating. The food was excellent, though we only had (1) breakfast meal there. Their's also an expedia representative in the lobby to assist w/ attraction pacakages to the various tourist spots. Their's also a pool if you wanna just hang out and get a tan (provided mother nature is kind). Check-in and out was very easy and trouble free. Free parking and wi-fi came in extremely handy! The AC was awesome...we set it to high when we left and by the time we came back the room was super cold which helped to offset the hot weather during the day. The only knack i would have against this place...and it may be very crude so continue reading at your own discretion...is that the toilet's are not superb. You must hold down the handle for a complete flush. Maybe it's an energy cost savings thing, who knows. And there are no fans either...say WHAAAAAT?!! LOL, i'm sorry if it grosses any readers out there but i believe these two things to be very important on a vacation. But other than this over-sight (which i'm not sure how much everyone values washroom viability) our stay was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service & perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: lady_britts
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a breath of fresh air, it was easy to find having driven up from Cocoa Beach. The parking was easy, the desk staff were accommodating and friendly and you were made to feel welcome. We were tired from having spent the day at the Magic Kingdom in Disney and the staff were very helpful. Showing us where to grab good food, telling us details about the area and offering a great deal for Sea World as this hotel was a sponsor. Our room was huge and comfortable facing the sparkling and inviting pool and from the window you could see the closing fireworks of Disney so the location was fantastic. They gave us free 'quick queue' tickets for Sea World and a free shuttle bus to and from the parks, so we were very happy. Knowing that after a long day of enjoying yourself at Disney you could come back to a swim and a fab hotel room was perfect. Stay here, it's very good value, the staff are great and the location is perfect with the nice end of International Drive two minutes drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Chestersmomma
Reviews.Content: I think this was probably one of the nicer hotels we saw at this location. Hubby and I had booked it online for a great, prepaid price. When we got there, check in was easy, and friendly. They had a neat little store where you could get things you needed or wanted by the front desk. They also had a business center where there were computers you could use. The room was clean and did the job for the night. The only real complaint I have is how much the prices were in that store by the desk. My husband paid quite a bit for a lean cuisine just because he was hungry and it was too late to go anywhere else. Overall it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price and Will Return”
Reviews.Author: fratwell
Reviews.Content: Selected the Hilton Garden Inn Orlando at SeaWorld to attend a conference that was located in the Disney area. However due to my company's per diem rule, had to select a hotel in the $90 Orlando Per Diem rate. From reading the previous Trip Advisor reviews on the Hilton Garden Inn Orlando at SeaWorld, I continued the positive reviews. Location was very convenient just off I-4 and have a 12 to 15 minute drive to Disney and Universal Studio. Only a 2 to 5 minute drive to Seaworld. Buffet breakfast was plentiful. Lots of fruit, pancakes, meats. The floor I was on was very quiet. The bed was very comfortable. Room comes with microwave and refrigerator. Very convenient to either pick up a microwable item either downstairs in the lobby area or a very short drive to CVS. The concierge person was very helpful describing the SeaWorld discounts. If I return back to the Orlando area, I will stay here again. The free internet was very good throughout my stay. There were no dropouts at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chad33418
Reviews.Content: The excellent service started at check-in (Steven) and then continued through the entire stay. I was traveling with my family and had to make a purchase of some forgotten toothbrushes in the hotel's pantry. This was not only very convenient, but also very economical which was a surprise. The room was excellent; we stayed in a 2 room suite, very comfortable and very clean. The hotel is within walking distance of both the attractions we went to during our stay. We took advantage of the "Quick Queue" wrist bands that you receive as part of the benefits. This experience ended with a breakfast in the restaurant located in the hotel. We again were greeted by a very friendly and professional staff (William). It is a buffet style breakfast; the food was very good, and very fresh. There was a wide variety of different foods. If you plan on visiting SeaWorld, I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Across from SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: traveler429
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 5 day stay. We were there towards the end of May. The lobby is open and feels so clean, they have a fish tank with salt water fish, an attraction/tourist desk where you can get information on the amusements around Orlando like SeaWorld or Disney World. They have a great breakfast spot, it's next to the lobby and breakfast is open from 6:30 to 11:00 AM. The breakfast is the best we've ever had at any hotel! They have waffles, which are amazing! There is sausage, bacon, eggs, pancakes, mashed potatoes, biscuits, bagels, so much fruit, cereals, donuts, and so much more! The wait-staff during breakfast is the same people every day and they are so nice! We had a King suite, there was a nice sized bathroom, which was very clean, a kitchen area that includes a microwave, mini fridge and coffee pot, the room has a flat screen TV and a desk. The bed is comfy but I found the pillows to be too poofy and too hard. The view we had was the SeaWorld parking lot/SeaWorld. The pool area is great, it provides you with a nice sized pool, great layout chairs, fresh towels, and music along with fountain jets in the pool that make a trickling water effect, the pool area is very relaxing. We had dinner there twice and it was room service style. The food is so good! One night we even had a brick oven pizza! We had a great stay and are looking forward to staying here again! Immaculate Hilton Garden Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay For The Price”
Reviews.Author: neovox
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to be smack dab in the heart of Disney, this probably isn't the place for you. However, if you're looking for a nice, clean, reasonably priced hotel within 10 minutes of Disney, Epcot, Universal, and everything else, then this is your place. We stayed for 5 days while visiting Epcot and Universal. The hotel was clean and meet all our needs. There's a nice pool and hot tub at the hotel, we only wished it was open later than 10pm. The hotel has a small bar and a restaurant. The restaurant has a buffet breakfast that was a bit pricey at $12, but had a good quality food and a huge assortment of things to choose from. Overall our stay was fantastic at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, will return for next trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: serenityNYC
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Orlando and had so many options for hotels. I wanted something close to Disney and close to Universal. I was happy to have found Hilton Garden Inn, it was close to everything...CVS down the block, 2-3 exits from disney (only about 10 minutes) and 10 minutes away from Universal. It was in a great area, not crowded with tourists and hotels like you would be on International Drive. Had a rental car so I didn't rely on any public transportation but I often saw a trolley pass right in front of the hotel. It was a breeze getting to and from the airport. Only spending 1.75 on tolls. The room was clean and big, great comfy huge bed. We didn't get our non smoking King bed so we had to get a smoking room, which I worried about because my partner and I are both asthmatics. It was not as bad as I thought it would be. I was expecting a smelly stinky floor (we were on 2nd floor) BUT NOT AT ALL. we did buy some Febreeze at CVS just in case but the smoking room we were at didn't smell or drive us crazy. We were in and out of the hotel all the time, aside from the check in person when we got there and the bartender (BRIAN) we didn't get to interact with any of the hotel staff. The bartender was very nice and had made some great drinks. The TV was great, just wish it had some spanish channels. The Microwaves and Fridge worked great so we had it stocked up with drinks and left overs. The bathroom was huge and always kept clean. I will definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely return on our next trip. Oh and p.S I loved that they had free WI-FI and FREE parking. There was always room in parking lot, choice between the front entrance or the back entrance (which you need your room key to open)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, great location and exceptional service! Definitely will come back!”
Reviews.Author: kwoodeshick
Reviews.Content: My children (6 & 2), the night we came home said, "I want to go back and sleep in our hotel room!" That sums it up! The hotel was in a wonderful location to SeaWorld, Discovery Cove, Aquatica and the bus from SeaWorld to Busch Gardens. It was also convenient to the trolley and public bus to go ANYWHERE and a CVS just in case you forget anything! EVERYONE was pleasant from the reservation coordinator (Nour), front desk staff (Patricia, Chris, Steven and so many others that greeted us regularly with a smile:), the restaurant staff (Gary, William, Suyin, Pilar and Guillermo!), a wonderful chef (Strose - who I personally miss his yummy omelets!), the maintenance staff, and the general manager (Mike). All of whom, knew us and called my children by name. The room was always very clean and spacious with a microwave/refrigerator...perfect when traveling with children, coffee available in the lobby at all times! :) Would definitely highly recommend this hotel. We are already planning our next trip to Orlando and we will definitely be staying at the Hilton Garden Inn - SeaWorld!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Spring Break 2011”
Reviews.Author: dstoffer
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn Seaworld comes through again, year after year. This is a fantastic Hotel w/ a great overall staff. This year they have Partnered w/ Seaword to offer guests a free Quick Que pass for seaworld... This puts you & your family at the front of the lines on all major attaractions, Manta, Kraken ( Unlimited Use ). This worked out great for our family & WOW did it ever save time in those lines... Thanks you for making this Spring Break all that more memorable. See you in the near future. The Stoffers Marietta, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “VERY FRIENDLY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: shelleyWakefield_uk
Reviews.Content: We finished our Orlando trip with two nights at this hotel. It was spotless with very comfortable beds. We got a friendly greeting by the reception staff who were very efficient at checking us in. We had an excellent meal in the restaurant which was very reasonably priced. All staff were very friendly towards us. The shuttle to the parks were dead on time, no waiting around. I would recomment this hotel to anyone who wishes to have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good for those going to the Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: stanMoscow
Reviews.Content: 10-15 minutes walk from the Seaworld. a great value for the money. clean and comfortable. waiters at dinner are quite slow, really slow. but that's the only minor bad thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: GoofyWelldone
Reviews.Content: We came back to Orlando from an 8 day cruise with Royal Carebean and we wanted to continue the party for 2 days but had to book a comfortable hotel fast and not too expensive. We found 2 rooms at this hotel next to Sea world. Since we're from Montreal and didn't know the city at all Thiago the manager showed us about how to use the bus in the city and Joseph showed us where to party in downtown Orlando. The rooms are great spacious with a nice big flat screen. Had a great relaxing time @ the hotel. The staff members were really helpfull in guiding us where the action was for shopping & partying :)

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value, Great Food & Great SeaWorld Location”
Reviews.Author: LounBee
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again! I booked this room 8 months in advance and for 4 people we got a room with breakfast included for $115 a night! The breakfast was phenomenal - Quiche, eggs made to order, potatos, pancakes, fruit, bisquits and gravy, cereals, donuts, belgian waffles with any type of toppings and so much more. The food was excellent quality and the service matched. The waiters/waitresses were very friendly and provided great service. While the hotel was booked for the night, we never heard a peep from anyone in nearby rooms or in the halls. It was very quiet. In addition they provided free 'Quick Queue' passes for the rides at SeaWorld which we used in addition to free sky tower passes and the Flamingo paddle boats. I was so mad we tried to eat a meal at SeaWorld before heading back to the hotel and spent $60 on crappy food, where we likely would have had a much better meal here. They had a shuttle to SeaWorld, but you might as well walk. They only made one other stop on the way there, but this hotel is 1 small block away from the end of the SeaWorld parking lot. This also saved us $15/day of SeaWorld parking, a plus. All in all, I wouldn't look anywhere else next time I visit Orlando, I will book here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando location, fantastic service, well pleased seasoned travelers”
Reviews.Author: vernkaye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both retired executives, and multi-year Hilton Diamonds) visit Florida each winter, then tour Europe each summer. Having stayed in hundreds (if not thousands) of hotels during our business years, and now in our leisure years; we know goodness when we see and experience it. A few years ago, we visited HGI Seaworld for a few days, then moved on to other Florida cities. Last year, we visited this property, stayed a month, but had prior commitments, so we moved on to Miami and Key West to enjoy other Hilton properties. This year, we decided to visit HGI Seaworld, over the year end holidays, with plans to move on to other Hilton properties though out Florida in January and February. Once the holidays were over, my wife and I realized that there were still interesting things to do at Millienium Mall, Florida Mall, and the two Premium Outlets; so we decided to extend our stay for a few more weeks. (The hotel is located between many nice shopping areas, and down the road from Disney attractions). After enjoying our shopping, we learned about Islewood, Bay Hill and the interesting lake properties around Orlando suburbs. So we spent many days looking at what real estate opportunities may be available in the area. Each morning we enjoyed our cooked breakfast, and after a few days, Gary (the restaurant manager) came to our table and let us know that it was nice to have us as his guests, and that his staff, Pilar, William, Guillerimo, Jose, Christina and others felt like we were part of the family. Each morning they greeted us with a smile and ushered us to a table that they kept especially for us. Then one morning it was obvious that with a full hotel, the breakfast staff was stressed because of a large convention, at the Convention Center on International Drive. That morning a tall handsome gentleman came over to our table and helped clean some of the plates, but took time to greet us and let us know that he had seen us, but we hadn't had a chance to chat. It happened that the gentleman was Mike, (the hotel's general manager) who was helping to serve the customers (one busy morning). His willingness to pitch in and serve the guests impressed us to no end. It was obviously his lead, that was what was behind "The Good Spirit of Warm Friendly Service" at the hotel. To make a long story short, we enjoyed getting to know Mike and his wonderful staff. Each time we passed the front desk, Patricia, Chris, Annie, Steven (and all the others managed to give us a smile, and say "Good Morning" or "Good Afternoon". In fact, after a hard day of shopping, it was nice to hear one of Mike's staff say..."Welcome Home" On our final night; as I looked out the 7th floor window and was enjoying "The Seaworld fireworks" for the 52nd time this stay; I felt my wife's hand on my shoulder. I looked over at her, and saw that she had a tear in her eye. I said honey, what's wrong? She said:"I hate to leave home tomorrow". We decided not to buy a home, or condo in Florida. We'll just plan to return next year to our home away from home. Thanks, Mike, Gary and your entire staff for helping to end our 2010 with joy, and to kick off our 2011 with "Fantastic Memories".

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to spend a couple of nights”
Reviews.Author: MamaJojo123
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline and got a good deal. Close to Disney and shopping, decent and clean.

Reviews.Title: “All I got to say is wow wow wow”
Reviews.Author: RippingMK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2011 PGA merchindise Show in Orlando Florida. 5 stars. Great Stay Great Sleep great Location. Also It was sold out which I was impressed about. last year it was not. Great job guys hope I get to stay with you again real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Great Hilton Associates”
Reviews.Author: carrekei
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms which were spacious and very clean with two of them overlooking SeaWorld at the back of the hotel, which was great to view the Seaworld firework display on New Years Eve. One room was for my daughter and her two children one being three months old asked for crib no problem. This hotel has a great atmosphere the Hilton associates are always only to pleased to satisfy no matter who they were dealing with ie. an adult or my seven year old grandson In the morning you can get free coffee in the bar which I used daily while I waited for the family for breakfast while watching the news on the TV and using my laptop to use the free internet connection yes FREE The restaurant/bar serves excellent food no matter what meal or snack you choose. . Seaworld is a five minute walk away or use the hotel shuttle service which also goes to the other main parks, I don't know what else to say other than Great Hotel, Great Loaction and Fantastic Associates. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Hilton Seaworld Where Two Employees Exceeded All Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Miahwebb
Reviews.Content: Mr. Fatta, I wanted to take a minute to thank you for a PERFECT weekend at your hotel. I wanted to recognize Thiago Sobral for a grand-slam experience delivered to my newlywed wife and I. My wife and I were so surprised and pleased with the setup that you all arranged upon our arrival. I know that Chris Kosor played a part in the arrangements as well so I would like to recognize him too. I am so grateful for the experience that these two gave us as I had no way to do it without their super kind efforts, creativity, and exceptional "Make it Happen" attitude. It was such a joy and we will not only return in the future but we will also spread the word of what a great hotel that was for us. I have stayed at many hotels and resorts in the past. The brand I most often frequent is the Ritz-Carlton. I even carry the Lionhead on my keychain. I only mention this to emphasize that despite the exceptional 5 diamond service that I have become accustomed to Thiago, and Chris are as good as any that I have encountered in over 10 countries, and our stay at your property could have been confused for a 5 diamond experience because that is what we got. Clearly upper management needs to be aware of the exceptional experience that these two created and then ensured that we had. With sincerest regards, JW

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and EASILY WALKABLE to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: davidjbrooks
Reviews.Content: It makes me laugh when reading reviews saying its a long walk from the hotel to the park. This is utter rubbish - I am sure there are some parts of the Park car park that are further away ! The secret is not to walk to Seaworld via the cars main entrance - just walk round the back of the hotel directly to the main park entrance - 5 minutes maximum. We were extremely satisfied with the hotel, nice and quiet, very convenient, quite new and therefore nice and clean and smart. Theres a large 24 hour pharmacy (CVS) just the other side of the road, and they sell all the basic provisions you might need. Its really easy to get onto the I4 and up to the other end of International Drive via Turkey Lake Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: cpinktinkerbell
Reviews.Content: Very close to Seaworld parks so if that is the main parks you want to visit it is perfect. Rooms large and very comfortable, had a great view of Seaworld, some kitchen facilities, Neutrogena toiletries provided. Great stay overall, felt chilled out away from busy International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, lovely room, V good quality breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: scaredcat
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel rushing into the gorgeous air con foyer. We arrived early but the staff were accomodating and found us a room. Our room overlooked the back of the hote, with stunning views of Orlando, with Sea World just across the road. Our room was a twin double with big flat screen tv! The cleaning staff were fantastic, the rooms were lovely and they even promply changed the light bulb when one went in our room. The hotel has a lovely pool at the front with jacussi. You never felt crowded in the hotel, the reastaurant at breakfast time we were treated like first class customers by the staff, the quality of the food was excellent with so much choice! The staff remembered you and what you ordered! The front staff were helpful with postage, going out of their way to help me post something to an american friend. In the front lobby was a concierge staff desk who could not have been more helpful in advising us and we purchased our i-ride tickets from him. When we used the restaurant in the evening, service was varied and the food not always available! Which was a real shame as it let down the excellent service in the mornings. Its located at the end of the i-ride, Sea World end, which its the quiet end, with an i-ride stop outside. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the main parks, beware this gets busy so queue up earlier for the return trips as it does other hotels in the area. Good laundry service, with daily USA Today papers provided.

Reviews.Title: “definitely go back again”
Reviews.Author: goldfish2000
Reviews.Content: We were there for Sea World and Aquatica 14 days package deal. Our family mainly focus on spending most of our time at Sea World. We didn't have time to use Hotel pool since they close due to weather. Hotel has shuttle bus to Sea World at 9:30 and pick up at 6:00 pm, but we pretty much walked ourselve. My 12 and 9 yrs old had a great time there. The room was huge and very clean. Air con working perfect. Laundry coin service on 6 and 3 floor,wash 25 mins, and dry 25 mins. Very convenience if you stay many days like us. CVS drug store across street. We purchase some snacks and water there. Breakfast was great. $10.95 for adult (not sure), but it was great. Waitress were very friendly. Free yummy cookies every evening. Close to International street. We took a green trolly to International street.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay while visiting Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: KU9Z
Reviews.Content: As experienced driving vacationeers my Family is pretty hard to impress. We average over 4000 driving miles/year and stay in 7-10 hotels/year. The Hilton GArden Inn Orlando SeaWorld is one of the best we've experienced. The staff was cheerful and helpful. The rooms were clean and room service was prompt. The breakfast was well stocked and had an excellent variety of hot and cold dishes. The quick 15 minute walk to the SeaWorld front gate is very convenient. And free parking in this day and age where every hotel seems to be hitting you up for parking fees, valet, and bell service. A few dollars saved was appreciated. A great stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Sea world close. Good business stop as...”
Reviews.Author: RJ24R2
Reviews.Content: Sea world close. Good business stop as have come to expect from hgi. This one no different. A little harder to get too than others as is NRA seaworld. But good clean place. Free parking too which was unexpected that close to park.

Reviews.Title: “Very very pleased - walking distance to Seaworld. Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: pknho
Reviews.Content: All in all, very pleased for the price. Very pleasant in comparison to the other econo lodges / motels in the area, you actually feel homely in the rooms. Bed was great! Staff were very friendly. Location is excellent for Seaworld. It is a 10 min walk to the main gate, also from there you can get the shuttle to Aquatica. I can not comment on the food as I did not eat there (apart from the complimentary cookies they had in reception which were nice). The surrounding area is quiet at night, but not in a bad way, it's a little off the beaten track of iDrive, but I did not feel unsafe at all when returning at night. If you are looking to stay in this area then stay here, you will not regret it. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you need a nice safe, comfortable good value hotel in the area. I slept very well here which is the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic time in Orlando.....would recommend! :)”
Reviews.Author: MaxineW1
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Hotel Inn near Seaworld . Reasonably priced hotel, good customer service, ver helpful staff, good food, pool open until 10pm, room pretty basic but when if visiting the attractions then you only need the room for sleep! Quiet location with restaurants in walking distance. International Drive Trolley (bus) stop + Lynx bus stop on Westwood Boulevard, outside of hotel. Free shuttle bus to parks but I Trolley very convenient too. International Drive 15 mins on trolley with may fantastic eating places. Would recommend hotel as in walking distance from Seaworld and Aquatica. Orlando is one awesome holiday destinations. Will return and 'do' it all again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Seaworld Parks & Orlando in general”
Reviews.Author: gclancy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a Great location for Seaworld, Discovery Cove and Aquatica. You could walk but who does that in America?! Its a 3* hotel but it was quite comfortable and fine for our needs. Universal and Disney were only a 10 min drive away as was Mall at Millenia. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “hotel nice, package issues”
Reviews.Author: travelismylife10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with very roomy rooms and you can see SeaWorld attractions from your window if you are at the back of the hotel like we were. We had issues with our hotel/SeaWorld package, which was a HUGE hassle (standing in many lines at SeaWorld and trying to get it fixed with the hotel). The Group person there was very nice but make sure you read every line of your package deal to make sure you get what you THINK you're getting! Families with SMALL children -- this is QUITE A LONG WALK to the main entrance of SeaWorld and we are an active family in good fitness. Very tiring after a long day at the park. The shuttle only runs 2 times a day at not very convenient times but you can drive (but then you'd have to pay parking, I think?). The pool is small but nice. Good parking. Rooms were VERY nice.

Reviews.Title: “A short walk from Shamu!”
Reviews.Author: scubalassy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for 10 days and found it to be very comfortable. The room was huge, very clean, well maintained and well equiped- hair dryer, iron, free wi-fi. The bed was massive!! and so comfortable with soft squishy pillows that made for a great nights sleep :) Best of all- so quite!! No noise at all so many zzzzzzzzzzzz to keep us happy after long days at parks. The staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel has a free shuttle bus that takes you to the parks- Epcot or Universal. While we were there It ran twice in the morning to each place (about 8 and 11) and picks up in the evening late afternoon and at 9.30 from Epcot allowing you to see the illuminations. Dont forget that you can hop around using disney transportation once you are at one park so the shuttle whilst its not frequent is more than adequate for your needs. We took the shuttle once ( so we could drink) and found it most useful.The hotel has a bar, restaurant, pool, laundry room- pretty much everything you need on site. We drove so got breakfast from places on international drive- if you dont drive I would say that you would need to eat in the hotel as there are no restaurants within walking distance. The itrolly bus picks up all along the street outside tho so you can always hop on that to get places. The best thing about this hotel is the fact that is is right on Seaworlds doorstep and a short walk to Discovery cove. We walked over to Seaworld in 10 mins saving on the parking :) I would reccomend this hotel and would stay again as the location is great. Just off the I4 its a short drive to all the theme parks ( disney about 15mins away) you have premium outlets 10 min drive away- great for picking up some bargains!

Reviews.Title: “best amenities, location, comfort, price A+++ orlando vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: jenniibux
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Orlando for the first time in about 20 yrs for a bday trip, to visit Disney and Seaworld. We checked in about 5 pm on a thurs, a short 12 min or so cab ride ($37 bucks) and we were at the Hilton Garden Inn. Very clean, well air conditioned, CLEAN NEW hotel w/pool bar, and restaurant all there. I loved the aqaurium too, i found a dog fish in there that looked, well, like my dog i had to leave at home, so i made sure to say hello to this cute fish everyday!. The supervisor, James, at HiltonGarden Inn was an awesome guy. Very polite and cool to talk to, served us delicious drinks at the bar. I chose this hotel because of the free shuttle to disney (VERY VERY cost efficient because its FREE) and its literally walking distance to Seaworld, or you can also take a free shuttle just down the block. They pick u up at a bench right in front of the hotel pool. So helpful! Our room was on the 4th floor, Room 434, nice view of pool and palm trees so i could look down and check to make sure hot tub wasnt busy (oh yeah did i mention that previously? awsome hot tub for those sore feet from walking at disney all day!) . Our bed was SO COMFY, very nice sheets, room was simple but very nice. Free WIRELESS internet! yay! we also enjoyed room service for an early dinner. This place was the best. and we got a great deal ( on expedia.com) . Anyone staying in Orlando, looking for quality and comfort with a good deal and close to free shuttleand ofcourse Seaworld and Disney, you must stay here its better then any hotel in the area. for what you pay and how much free you get, you cant go wrong staying here. :) Its also a short ,13 dollar cab ride to International Drive, hotspot for shopping, amazing bars, nightclubs, and delicious places to eat !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service - and great location”
Reviews.Author: drawoha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn Seaworld on three separate occasions during our vacation. The reception team and indeed all staff were at all times friendly and welcoming. Special thanks & mention for Chris, Stevan & Patricia who were most helpful to us. The restaurant teams (breakfast & dinner) also gave us a warm greeting and the food quality and value is good. The breakfast selection really sets you up for the day and dinner is served to 1000pm which is good for a late arrival such as ours. The hotel location is excellent as it is adjacent to the I4 and also to Seaworld (the Tower / flagpole is a great location finder). We booked here on the basis of the Tripadvisor reviews which we found to be very relevant & accurate. There is plenty of free parking and the free wifi is a nice facility. I'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. We chose the package including tickets / passes for Seaworld & Busch Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: honesty1st
Reviews.Content: In comparison to same standard European Hotels I was a bit dissapointed. Windows not opening is a big minus - I don't know if this is due to safety regulations but I really would have appreciated some fresh air !. Room was not as spacious as I had expected and beds where smaller than a normal double bed. Staff are friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Great HGI”
Reviews.Author: gvldiva
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. Staff - Accomodating and very nice. Explained amenities. Wait staff in restuarant nice as well. Cleanliness - Clean eveywhere we went in the hotel. Common areas and restrooms clean. Our room was very nice and perfectly clean. Location - Great! Next to Seaworld. Complimentary shuttle to Disney. On the I Ride Trolley Line. Couldnt have been better Rooms - Very comfortable and clean. Slept like a baby. Vslue - I purchased the seaworld package. I received 2 seaworld tickets for $139/night. BTW...Seaworld tickets for children cost more than $70/day I would definitely come back to this hotel. BTW - The restuarant in the hotel was good for breakfast, but I wouldn't do lunch there. Bar was good too!

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Seaworld! Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wispr
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it was close to Seaworld. It was an easy walk and after traveling two days in a car, it was nice not having to drive to Seaworld. Check in was smooth, and the staff was friendly. We had a suite and it was very nice and clean. The hotel was full, but did not seem busy. There seemed to be room at the restaurant and bar areas. We did not get a chance to use the pool and hot tub very long. Weather closed the pool. But the time we had by the pool was nice. The area was clean and the water in the pool was warm, and the hot tub was hot. I would stay here again. Probably a little pricey considering we spent most of our time at Seaworld and not much time at the hotel. So if your looking for just a place to sleep, someplace else might work and do less damage on your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “I don't need a sentence, just one word: Awful.”
Reviews.Author: mweavil
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and immediately things did not go well. They managed to mess up the reservations we had made online and thus had confirmation for (we had a reserved a king bed and they gave us two doubles)... ridiculous, but understandable that accidents happen. The desk clerk claimed the hotel was full and that only a few rooms were available, which would have been believable if the hotel parking lot wasn't more than half empty. Our only request was to not have a room by the elevator as the individual I was traveling with is a very light sleeper, the clerk assured us the room was far from the elevator. Upon exiting the elevator, there was the room... not just close to the elevator, but the CLOSEST room to the elevators. Upon returning to the desk to swap rooms, the clerk was very rude and unhelpful. We had to swap to the smoking floor to get a decent room, which was not preferable and definitely took away from the experience. The rooms are moderate at best... I've paid a lot less for a lot more (for instance one day prior staying at a Hyatt, the room had a mini kitchen, full sitting area with couch and 42" plasma HD TV). The AC was on high and extremely cold with the knobs broken off, making life in the room very unpleasant. Also, the drawer in the desk was installed upside down, rendering it useless. On the plus side, the restaurant inside the hotel was very good, the restaurant staff was extremely pleasant, and the manager of the restaurant was extremely polite and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient hotel for families in holidays.”
Reviews.Author: LuizAlf
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel, with my family, from February 13th till February 20th. First thing that must be pointed out is that this is not an extra-luxury hotel, as many of the Hilton chain, are. There’s no frill, people to carry your luggage and things like this. But, it is an extremely convenient hotel, if you are looking for a 3-4 stars hotel for your family on holidays in Orlando, with a reasonable price (I paid US$ 55 per night. But up to US$ 90-US$ 100, I consider it a bargain). In fact, room and bathroom are spacious. There are two queen size beds in every room, so a couple with two children can be well accommodated. The room is very well equipped since there’s a fridge (a small one) and a microwave oven. Finally, and what is more important for me and my wife, the room, the bathroom and the hotel in general are extremely clean. So, I highly recommended this hotel for families who are looking for a very clean hotel with a good price, with no frill and with facilities for children.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with lots of small touches”
Reviews.Author: midliferDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: Loved the upgraded linens and duvets but agree with another poster that a light blanket might be nice as sometimes the duvet is too thick to be comfortable but a sheet is not enough. Did not try the restaurants but did avail myself of the free cookies on the check in desk each evening. What a welcome treat! Beware that the Seaworld crowd with kids in tow wake up early and sometimes can be VERY noisy. The good news is that the halls in the late evening are very quiet. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: vcan
Reviews.Content: stayed again at this hotel this was our 4th visit this hotel is a real gem we use it because its easy for travelling about the orlando area but be warned you will need a car as the local trolley does not serve it and you will need a taxi if you dont have a car the hotel is very clean inside and out the pool area is quite good with a plentifull supply of towels available to guests the rooms are very very modern and comfortable and the housekeeping service in of a high standard the breakfast buffet is really good with a large variety to suit almost everyone the evening menu is rather small but the food is really good staff and managment are friendly and very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location...nothing fancy.”
Reviews.Author: havecurveswilltravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with my sister (my normal traveling partner). Hotel was clean and bright. Pool and hot tub were very nice. The weather was horrible all week so we really didn't get to use them. The television was a bit older but worked just fine. I don't have any real complaints about the hotel. I also don't have any real praises to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Elevator signal might disturb you”
Reviews.Author: Sausewind
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room close to the elevator. Always there was a disturbing signal when the elevator reached the floor. If the hotel is fully booked this can really disturb you. The distance to SeaWorld is a 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: taybra27
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel at 2am one morning after roaches kicked us out of another hotel. This hotel made us feel like royalty. We still talk about this trip. Boy did they take care of us. and thats why we are going back in December 09.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this place for a Sea World Get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: kathy884
Reviews.Content: My 14 year old son and I just got back from a mini three night get-a-way here. We loved this place. (We had a view of Sea World, could walk to and from Sea World, comfortable beds, outstainding customer service, reasonably priced tastey food, a great little pool area with a very warm pool (which my son and I love and look for) plus a hot tub). We booked the Sea World package that for an extra $20 a night offered two Sea World tickets (nice deal). We ordered room service twice: Kid meals my son ordered (pasta one night) (peanut butter and jelly the other) came with yummy fries and apple juice (actually drink of choice and this is what he picked) and were both under $5. The one night that I ordered room service too, I got a delicous salad and a tasty BBQ chicken sandwich. The salad was about $4 and the sandwich which included fries about $7. My only disappointment with food was the cost of breakfast $12 for the buffet or $8 for a continental breakfast. If you aren't getting the Sea World package, you might want a package that includes breakfast with your room. Rather than pay this, we ate snacks that we brought along or purchased in the little store by the front desk and left overs in our refrigerator for breakfasts. Next time, I'll bring a soft sided cooler with some breakfast items. Rooms have mini frig and a microwave. I liked this place so much that one day after being back, I booked another mini three day trip for March. Things to note: Bed are doubles rather than queens // Our air conditioning didn't work initially. This was fixed as soon as we made a call, but keep this in mind and call right away if you book here and find yourself in a room that isn't cooling off right away when you turn down the thermostat. Side Note on other ratings of the property: I was very surprised to see that the Unofficial Guide to Walt Disney World only gave this property a 65 for a quality rating. I've stayed at six other Orlando properties listed in this guide that were ratings between 93 and 75 which I thought that the guide had rated appropriately. The low rating for this place just didn't make any sense to me, and usually I think the unofficial guide is right on. // Tip regarding Sea World -- walking over is great. After a busy day at the park, though, walking back isn't as appealing. Take the parking lot shuttle to the far parking lot, though, when leaving the park and that eliminates a good part of your walk back.

Reviews.Title: “All in one vacation hotel, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: FunFamilyFL
Reviews.Content: We really liked having all of the ammenities, plus easy access to everything local. The pool area was great and service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the price.”
Reviews.Author: 126chelsea
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price, rooms were clean and a good size. Nice pool area. Very close to attractions. Would definitely stay agin. Good for business but would also be great for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: FortLaudtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at this hotel. It is very clean and the rooms are quite spacious. Its nice to have the added conv of a refrig, microwave and coffee service in the room. (they should add an in room safe). The rooms are nicely appointed with large 42 inch flat screen tvs. The pool is heated which makes its very relaxing after a long day. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone going to SeaWorld, Discovery Cove or Aquatica. Yes you can walk to SeaWorld!! (its a nice long walk, but doable). There is a shuttle if you dont want to walk. Stay here you will like it!! Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight trip to Orlando”
Reviews.Author: smart82gurl
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Garden Inn Sea World had everything that you would expect from a Hilton Hotel. My husband and I had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but fix the air con, please!”
Reviews.Author: AandL11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the HGI at Seaworld for 11 nights in September. We got a great deal with Travel Republic in the UK with full buffet breakfast included in the cost. We've previously stayed at the Peabody and Renaissance at Seaworld, and I have to say the customer service and care at the HGI was every bit as good - if not better as those two higher class hotels. The HGI is located just across the road from Seaworld's car park and is a brisk 15 minute walk to their front gate. Overall we had a great stay. The beds are very comfy, the rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day, breakfast staff and all front desk staff were very polite and helpful. The pool looks fine but we didn't use it, nor did we use the exercise room, but it always looked very quiet. Just off the reception is a "pantry" which stocks a range of sweets and drinks and pre-packed food for use in the in-room microwave. And because you use reception to pay for anything, it's open 24hrs a day. And adjacent to that is the "business centre". Two PC's for surfing and checking emails and one dedicated "airline check in terminal". All rooms and communal area's had Wi Fi as well, so constant surfing the whole time on my laptop. The biggest problem we had was with the room air conditioner. I can't understand why ALL reviews on here don't mention this. The air con machines for all the rooms in this hotel are actually located IN THE ROOM, sitting just under the window. As such, when the fan kicks in you get the full volume of the fan blowing then when the cooling compressor kicks in you get the rattle and humm from this too. Either one would be bad enough, but when the two are running at full pelt, the noise is unbearable. The first couple of days we resorted to cooling the room to freezing point in the day then pulling the plug out the wall when we went to bed. Got fed up of this tack eventually so complained to the front desk and they admitted the air con machines were noisey and were all due to be replaced. New ones had just arrived in fact.... so, ours was replaced for a nice shiny new one that day. First class service. But! The only difference was that the fan control had a "half speed" setting on it, so it was a wee bit quieter. At least we were able to cool the room and sleep, so the holiday wasn't ruined. The way the problem was dealt with was first class. We were treated with respect and never felt we were wasting anyone's time. Any time they said something would happen, it did. It's just a shame these air con's are actually IN the room - never seen that before in any hotel. If this wasn't the case, this would have been a 5* review for a 5* quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, helpfull and in a good location”
Reviews.Author: dgas30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the bottom of 'i-drive' and literally the back of the hotel you can see seaworld and walk to the seaworld car park in 5 mins. The hotel is also right on a stop for the 'i-trolley' to take you anywhere else. The hotel stands alone with plenty of parking. The lobby is spacious and smart and there is a restaurant there and to the other side is the bar, and beyond the bar the small but well kept pool area. There is also a concierge desk who are very willing and not sales-pushy to offer advice and you can purchase park tickets and i-trolley passes. The hotels 'exercise' room is also on the groundfloor, there never seemed to be anyone using it, my husband used it, all machines modern and good. The room is a good size and looks fairly new. There is a nice bathroom that is clean with a good shower and fresh towels daily. There is a fridge, microwave and coffee machine. Also you have an iron and ironing board. We had a new flat screen telly delivered whilst we were there (they were upgrading all the TV's) there is a small desk with internet access. If you check in ask for a room at the back of the hotel, that way you get a great view of seaworld and thier coasters! The rooms are cleaned immaculately every day. The only fault we can say is that our toilet blocked one evening and it took them a while to come up and fix it, but they didnt expect us to wait around so we went out and by the time we came back it was fixed and the floor had been thoroughly cleaned with bleach, so we couldnt knock the effort made to sort it out! There is an ice machine on every floor and also a laundry room. We didnt use the pool but there is plenty of loungers and shade and looked pleasent enought, only thing is that it is at the front of the hotel next to the car park, although there are plenty of shrubs/trees surrounding it so dont be too put off by that. The bar is a little pricey by Orlando standards but then it is a hotel bar, and a hilton hotel aswell so you kinda have to expect that. Overall we thought this hotel was brilliant. It was modern, secure, clean and generally very pleasant we would most definately be booking this one again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreadlockjack
Reviews.Content: Got a suite for a fair price on a short term booking after a horrible stay in another hotel, incl. braekfast. Nice pool, clean and spacious room, unfortunately next to the vending machines, which created some noise... Nice pool... All in all good Hilton Garden Inn standart.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we would stay here again......”
Reviews.Author: WalkinmyShoes
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed at this Hilton Garden Inn 2 years in a row and this review is for the latest stay during the week of July 27th and just about sums up both experiences. We made reservations through Expedia and received a great rate of $79.00 before taxes which was terrific! We requested a non-smoking room and even though these requests are always described as “requests” and not guaranteed we noted it was for health reasons. Well at check in the staff person we had was a little slow and by that I mean not physically. Sorry but she did not belong at the front desk! The process was quick thank goodness and as we always do we went straight to the room before lugging our bags to do an inspection. We exited the elevator onto an obvious smoking room floor. As we entered the room it was like entering a burning tenement in New York. I know I’ve experienced it! The smell of smoke was unbelievable. Back down to the front desk and this time was helped by a nice girl who “found” a room on the 8th floor. This room was smoke free but the wife and I did smell what can be described as a sour mildewy smell as if standing water that had not dried. We hoped that the smell was due to the air conditioner being set on low and went about our business. The second day of our stay I happened to walk barefoot over near the air conditioner and the floor was soaked through approximately 3 feet around the area! Hence the mildewy smell. No problem for us because this room was the last of the non smoking rooms so we jacked up the air and lit a candle. We notified the management upon checkout. Overall the hotel was clean and most all personnel were professional. The pool area is a little on the small side and the food at the restaurant was pretty good. No breakfast for us but the hamburger and fries I had was good as was the wife’s sandwich. The hotel is very convenient to SeaWorld which is a short walk approximately a quarter a mile. Saves the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind a smoking room, stay here! Otherwise, get here really early for the non-smoking rooms!”
Reviews.Author: FleurDeLis1222
Reviews.Content: We went to dinner before checking into this hotel- huge mistake! Upon arriving, we were given our room keys and headed to our room. The girl at the front desk didn't warn us that it was a "smoking" room, but I could smell it as soon as we got off of the elevator. Then, a wave of smoke hit us as soon as we opened the door. (My mother smokes, so I'm used to being around smoke, but she doesn't smoke in bed and the Hilton's rooms have no windows so the smoke here is strong and stale.) I immediately went to the front desk switch rooms and I was told that they had absolutely no non-smoking rooms left. I explained to her that I specifically booked a non-smoking room, per the options available online when booking, and I showed her my confirmation page proving my non-smoking purchase. She basically said that booking a non-smoking room only means that you're requesting a non-smoking room and that they can't honor all requests. I then asked if they could transfer us to another Hilton, since there are so many in the area, and she claimed that there was nothing that she could do. I came back a second time and was told again that nothing could be done. Thankfully, I ran into a manager on the way back to my room and, after about 1 hour of pleading, a room "suddenly opened up." One positive thing about the hotel: The Hilton's side street has a sidewalk & goes right into SeaWorld's parking lot. You can also take the SeaWorld shuttle directly to Aquatica from SeaWorld, but Aquatica completely closed their entrances around 11 am twice during our week due to "maximum capacity." We attempted to take the hotel's shuttle once, but it was running almost 30 minutes late & we didn't make it to Aquatica before they sealed the entrance. We left really early & walked the 2nd time, but Aquatica doesn't have very many slides and the wait for most of them was over 45 minutes. SeaWorld was awesome and they have a great offer only or Florida teachers: you get a free annual pass if you bring your teaching certificate, pay check stub, and school i.d. We had an amazing time at SeaWorld & I'd love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Garden inn as usual”
Reviews.Author: KBLA
Reviews.Content: This otel has a good location if you are there for leisure and business. was there for a convention and the location is great for such event. rooms were ordinary size and staff relatively friendly

Reviews.Title: “The stay was ok but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: ericpeggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 9 nights. If you want a hotel location which is closed to Disney, this is not for you. But I like the location because it is in the middle of everywhere. It is only 20 mins to airport and 20 mins drive to Disney and 15 mins to Universal Studio. And it is right next to Seaworld. Some people walked to Seaworld parking lot and took the tram to the gate. But I would not recommend hotel's shuttle which run only twice a day. Hotel staffs gave us 6th floor and facing Sea World. I would highly recommend that. We watched firework every night. That was awesome. If you need self-service laundry, they only have that on 3rd and 6th floor. That is why I recommended 6th floor. So you don't need to carry heavy bag of laundry to other floors. The hotel lobby is small and forget about swimming pool (tiny). Staffs were friendly. When we checked out, I got problem with the bills. The staff was helpfull to resolve the problem. We have stayed in other Hilton Garden Inn before. I think this hotel room is a bit smaller than others and the paint is kind of dated. In conclusion, for the price I paid it was a pretty good stay. Don't forget to visit Village Inn for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Nigelfromkent
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our third stay at the HGI Seaworld and this trip just as good as thr previous. Prior to arriving we had phoned to confirm our booking and request two adjacent rooms over looking Seaworld so that we would be able to see the fireworks at night. Upon check-in we were delighted that our request had been granted with an excellent view from the 5th floor. This visit the price we paid was the same as last year but had the added bonus of including breakfast which saved us $50 per day (or $700 for the two week stay). The staff were fantastic, as ever and we were greated and treated with warmth. All of the breakfast staff remembered us from last year. The evening waitresses were fantastic with my young daughter. The food was great and reasonably priced. Mike Flatta, the General Manager was great and made the effort to talk to most guests but was genuinely nice as well. Rooms were clean. We had poblem with a blocked toilet that was dealt with promptly and efficiently. My only criticism would be that when the hotel is running at full occupancy, the restaurant can get a bit hectic at breakfast. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: michn
Reviews.Content: My husband and 6 yr old son stayed here from June 25th through June 30th, 2009 for my husband's 40th birthday/vacation celebration and could not be happier with this hotel. The purpose of the trip was to go to Disney , Sea World, and other local attractions like Blizzard Beach and the Kennedy Space Center. First of all, the location was fantastic!! Right off all major highways, 10-15 min to Disney attractions ,and right next door to Sea World. It was so convenient! The room was wonderful, clean, and always comfy to come back to after a day at the parks. Although the pool is small, it does its job for cooling off in the late afternoons before heading out at night. The service was wonderful, everyone was accomadating, and the breakfasts were fantastic in the mornings. Since we are early risers, we would be at the restaurant in the lobby by 7:30-8a.m. Everything you could want was available from eggs and bacon/sausage, to cereals, hot and cold, to danishes, fresh fruit, waffles, pancakes, coffee/tea, etc. The staff at the restaurant were so nice that for the morning of my husband's actual 40th birthday, they surprised him with a slice of cake and a candle and sang to him before we headed off to the Magic Kingdom. It really was a nice touch. Can't say enough about this hotel....We have stayed before in the Disney hotels, and I have to say this experience was much better. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RoxieEm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, June 30, with sole purpose of visiting Sea World and Aquatica. Walked to Sea World from here with no problems, but it might be a bit challenging with very young children unless they're in a stroller. Hotel is wonderful; has free parking. Neighborhood seemed safe. Hotel parking lot is well lit. Our room (king-size bed) was spacious and very clean; the bed was SO comfortable!. Loved having the in-room microwave to make breakfast, which we brought along since we're not huge breakfast eaters. Also, would rather spend the $11-$12 per person on lunch/dinner at Sea World. Used large desk in the room as our table. Hotel restaurant did look very nice--roomy, clean. Our room was poolside; pool was beautiful; closes at 10:00 PM so no need to worry about being kept awake by pool noise/activities after that time. Specifically wanted a hotel within walking distance of Sea World, and this hotel seemed to be the best value for what we wanted. Got a good price with AAA discount. Will definitely stay here again our next trip to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Dordie
Reviews.Content: Walk to Seaworld. Nice hotel. Rooms a bit small but very comfortable. Micro & fridge. Breakfast buffet costs 10.95 in lobby but it was decent and worth the money. Pool area attractive but a bit on the smaller side. Would stay there again. Booked through priceline and got a real bargain. Very happy. Just off on ramp for Disneyworld, which is about 6 miles away or so.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay when visiting Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: mkharbor
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and really enjoyed it. My wife loves Sea World and it is an easy walk from the hotel. There is a sidewalk that takes you right to SeaWorld's parking lot (we are both seniors and it only takes us only about 10 minutes to get there). Disney and Universal are only a short ten minute drive, and Aquatica and Discovery Cove about three minutes. The staff here is very friendly, you might even be greeted by Mike, the general manager, when you go down to breakfast. They have a very nice pool and spa, the rooms are always clean, and you get lots of towels. We have already booked for next winter. What I liked best, the staff, and being close to SeaWorld. The least, having to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, walking distance to Sea World *BUT*...”
Reviews.Author: summerinplaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hilton for two nights for the sole purpose of going to Seaworld. The hotel was very close to Seaworld and many reviewers stated that they walked there, so we were planning on doing that, and were glad to save the $10 dailly Seaworld parking fee. Hilton also offered a free shuttle daily to and from Seaworld. However... the hotel IS within walking distance to Seaworld, but the walk is not user-friendly. There are no sidewalk areas. We had to cross over and walk in along the side of a busy road and through the Seaworld parking lot. We did use the shuttle to get there the next day, but the return shuttles were very limited, and only come back at 5 and 7 pm (although Seaworld closes at 10 pm in the summer months because of nighttime shows/fireworks). So we found ourselves walking back to the hotel, at night, in the dark, through service areas/back parking lots of another nearby hotel, through dark parking lots and roads. It was very unnerving. The hotel should consider adding a later shuttle during the summer months to accommodate people who are going to Seaworld and staying for the summer night shows. If there were lit accesses/sidewalks, it would be different. The room was very nice and the beds were comfortable. The pool area was great, and the in-hotel restaurant had a breakfast buffet daily (although it is $12 per person.) The staff were very nice and very helpful. We would definitely stay here again, but would choose to pay and park at Seaworld instead of walking. I would review this hotel highly but encourage families with kids not to necessarily count on walking to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Convension Centre”
Reviews.Author: ceerbl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for three nights and had an excellent experience. Helpful and knowledgable staff, clean room with great housekeeping, good breakfast with great service and a comfortable bed. Aircon was OK although I went for the 'chill the room when out and switch off during the night' technique to keep noise down. I also switched off the fridge at night as this was a little noisy too but these are minor comments about an overall fantastic stay. I would definitely choose HGI for any future business trips to Orlando. I chose Hilton Garden Inn based on previous experience with the chain and TripAdvisor comments about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected- very nice”
Reviews.Author: rhoke
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here while doing a day @ Disney...got a REALLY good rate through priceline. Beds were just OK, but room had fridge and microwave- just what a traveling family was looking for!! Mini store in hotel sold micro popcorn and dinners (although pricey- as expected). Pool is outdoor, but heated to a VERY nice temp. 15 min from Orlando Airport, 10 from Disney...perfect! No complaints for our money. Free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Could not keep my son out of the Gorgeous Pool!”
Reviews.Author: bellou3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HGI on a 2 day trip to Seaworld and were pleasantly surprised. Not only was it walking distance from the park, the hotel had a great restaurant, lounge, pool and spa to offer. It was great to be able to get back from Seaworld, shower and head down for dinner and drinks. My son LOVED the pool. It's heated to bath water temperature and the hot tub was great after running around all day. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “This HGI is Excellent!! Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: vacationer16
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the HGI in early May for 2 nights. I got a great deal through Priceline and was happy to learn that i was staying at this hotel. Rooms are very comfortable, the king bed is so big. It also has a desk, free wi-fi and wired internet, an ergonomic work chair, 25 inch TV, air conditioning, closet, iron and ironing board, microwave, minifridge, coffee maker, full equipped bathroom and Neutrogena amenities. It has no safety deposit box. Parking is free. Pool is nice and has a hot tub and fitness center. Free coffee and oatmeal cookies in the lobby each day. Shuttle to the parks and airport. A business center with printer and airline check-in kiosk is available free of charge. After i learned about my reservation, i contacted the hotel directly and asked for Nour, who gently and kindly assigned me the type of room i wanted. The hotel is in a very quiet area. It is in the corner of Central Florida Parkway and Westwood Boulevard, off I-4, very close to the Premium Outlets and Sea World is just behind it. Check in was a breeze, early check-in is possible depending on availability as well as late check out. I was able to get late check out until 1pm. Steven in the front desk was very helpful with directions, recommendations and more. On the check in moment, they give you a coupon for 2 bottles of water in their pantry and a 2x1 drink coupon in the hotel´s bar per stay. Breakfast was good, has sausages, eggs, biscuits, muffins, cereal juices, bread, yogurt, etc. It is a $10 buffet. All in all i had a pleseant stay. I would definitely recommend it to everyone and will be looking forward to go back again on my next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Large, clean and comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SCarolina
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves more than 3 stars that it has gotten because it was great. Rooms are very clean and large. Comfy beds and very clean linens.
